loans.name: Alidjon

texts.ru: Зиеев Алиджон житель Вхдата. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 48 лет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства.Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Обратился за кредитом , чтобы получить возможность купить породистого бычка. Использовать его он хочет в целях разводить породистое потомство. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.Его дело приносит неплохие доходы. Но кроме него в семье работает его дочь. Она торгует на рынке овощами и фруктами.
texts.en:
Alidjon Z. lives in Vahdat. He is 48 years old, married and has four children. His business is animal husbandry. He has a small farm where he raises cattle. His business is profitable. His daughter also works outside the home. She sells vegetables and fruits at a market. Alidjon wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase a purebred bull. He wants to use the bull to breed and raise purebred offspring. Alidjon will be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a purebred bull

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan C., 38, is the mother of two young children and works with her husband selling firewood. On average, this couple makes a combined income of around US$ 10 every day. Two of her children are in school. Currently, she lives in Prey Veng province. She would like to like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a trailer to transport wood; any remainder would be used to purchase more wood for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and wood for re-sale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. is 49 years old and lives with her married child and her mother in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a widow and has a business as a taxi-driver. Besides this activity, she also purchases yams and cashew nuts from individual growers and re-sells them to market wholesalers. On average, she makes US$ 5 in revenue every day. Her daughter stays at home and cooks for the family members. To make more money to help support the family, Mrs. Ly S. is asking for a loan to rent yam and cashew nut plots directly from growers.

loans.use: renting fields

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Jamila has made a living selling clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125 and works at her business for 14 hours a day. Jamila is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  

Jamila is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 11, 6 and 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long K. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$ 2 a day. Long has one child and so far she is still living with her elderly mother. Lately, she has requested a loan to purchase a grinding machine. This mill will be a service to the local farmers to take off the rice husk and an income-generating business for Long. (Long's husband is pictured at their home.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Saranhuu

texts.en:
Saranhuu B. lives with her husband and 14-year-old son in a "ger" (Mongolia's traditional nomadic housing) in a ger district (a sort of ad hoc suburb) on their own small plot of land. Currently, her husband is unemployed. She graduated from the university as a mechanic, however, she worked as a teacher for many years at a kindergarten in the city of Darkhan, Mongolia's third-largest city.

In 2000, the family moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since they moved, she has begun to run a retail business at the Narantuul, Mongolia's biggest outdoor market. Her business capital was 700,000 MNT ($1 USD=1550 MNT). She buys office supplies and school supplies such as paper, pens, files, notebooks, staples etc. from a border city with China called Ereen, or from the wholesalers. Saranhuu is a longtime borrower with XacBank, Kiva's partner micro-finance institution in Mongolia. She is taking a loan to buy more goods to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy office supplies and school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Хамдамова Саноат проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 39 лет. Уже 15 лет занимается выпечкой лепешек и их реализацией. Для ремонта лепешечной решила получить кредит . Это поможет улучшить условия работы . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sanoat H. lives in Vahdat. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. She has been baking and selling traditional flatbread for 15 years. Sanoat decided to obtain this loan to renovate her bakery and improve working conditions. She will be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bakery renovation

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. Since 1985, she has been growing rice and vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1.50 every day. Her husband helps support the household by working as recycler. He goes from house to house to purchase recycling items and sell them to the market-recycler to earn approximately US$ 3.50 in profit per day. This couple has 2 young children, both of whom attend school.<>

Mrs. Chum S. would like to take out a loan to make two investments. She will provide $200 to her husband so he can use it to purchase more recycling items, and the rest will be used to buy farmland to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: buying farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gravel and sand for resale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., 49, is married and lives with four of her children in Prey Veng province. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband, pictured here, is a motor-taxi driver and makes US$ 2 in profit a day. Mrs. Keo is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband as the old one is often fixed and uses a lot of gas while operating.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his business

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka Q. is a 54-year-old woman who runs a store, where she sells food products such as juices, tea, candies, and cookies. She is married with 3 children.

With the first loan she received from Aqroinvest, Maleyka was able to increase her stock. Now, Maleyka would like to apply for a second loan to increase the variety of food products in her store. For this purpose, she applied for a 1200 USD loan. Maelyka successfully repaid her first loan to Agroinvest.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk K., 28, lives with her husband and elderly father in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She is does housework and takes care of her young child. Her husband, who is pictured with Uk here, is a farmer. He grows and sells vegetables at the market and makes around US$ 4.50 per day. This couple would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizer to expand their cultivation.

loans.use: fertilizer for their farming

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg S. is a single mother who lives with her son in her own house in the "ger" district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. (A ger is a traditional nomadic Mongolian home.) Since she began selling used handbags at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia, she has bought a place to live and a retail stall at the Narantuul market for her brother. She is one of XacBank's (Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia) best borrowers, with a sterling credit history for the past five years. Erdenechimeg is a very responsible person. Her goal is to expand her own house. She wants this loan to buy more used handbags and leather bags (used handbags come from South Korea and are sold by the kilogram) to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy used handbags and leather bags

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan P., 50, grows and sells rice in the Prey Veng province. She is married and has two children, both of whom still live at home. Her husband is a farmer. Tan typically makes about USD $2 each day, and would like a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea M. is 44 years old and resides with her husband and seven children in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers. They grow and sell rice and vegetables, but they earn less than $1 a day. Fortunately, five of their children also work; two are employed as garment factory workers, one is a staff member in a private company, and two others are laborers. They always share their pay with their parents so they can manage their daily expense. 
Mrs. Chea M. would like to take out a loan of $300 to use to help her daughter get a job at the garment factory.

loans.use: acquiring a job

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long Y., 59, is a traditional midwife in the Prey Veng province. On average, she makes about USD $4 a day, while her husband operates a moto-taxi and also earns about USD $4 a day. They have three children who are all are in school. Mrs. Long Y. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purcharse a motorbike.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children. This young man has been a farmer for more than five years. Together with his brother, they are growing diverse products such as potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers to support his young family. What pleases him is sewing his diverse crops because it is profitable to invest in a variety of vegetables and sell his harvest monthly. The most tedious part of his job is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his third loan with IMON International and he is promising to repay the current loan in time as he has done with the previous ones. Bahodir will invest the money in purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 
Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help poor and low income clients develop viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Shams

texts.en:
Shams J. is a single, 26-year-old woman who lives with her parents. She sells different kinds of food products and also works as a school teacher. Her salary from teaching is too small to cover basic family needs. That’s why she decided to start a private business two years ago.

Since 2006 her small shop has become very famous and popular among the locals. Shams would like to increase the number of products she sells, so she has applied for a 1200 USD loan. The loan will help her purchase more food products and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase food products.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., 45, is a professional seamstress who makes bout $5 every day. She has run this business for about 10 years. She lives in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province, with her husband, who is a teacher and earns $2.5 per day. This couple has four children. Two are still in school. The other two are self-employed; one works as a goldsmith and one as a hair dresser. Mrs. Sun would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase more sewing machines to expand her business.

loans.use: sewing machines

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Thouch R. is an elderly mother who is 55 years old. She has two childR. and lives with her husband in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow and sell rice at the market to earn approximately US$ 2 every day. They are supported by two childR., one who is a garment worker and another who is a laborer.

Mrs. Thouch R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to open a grocery store that her daughter will run. Once the loan is funded, her daughter will leave her job as a garment worker to operate the grocery store.

loans.use: starting up a grocery store

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida M. is a 47-year-old woman who breeds cattle in the small village of Imishli. She started her business more than ten years ago and now has three cattle. She purchases calves in the local livestock bazaar and fattens them up for sale. After several months, she sells them to local people or to the restaurants.

Valida is married and has 3 children. She is proud that her children help with the business, but she's more interested in their future. Valida dreams of providing her children with a high-quality education.

Valida would like to expand her business and purchase two more calves, so she has applied for a 1200 USD loan for the term of 15 months. Valida is counting on your helping hand.

loans.use: Purchase 2 calves

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Born in 1972, Ramazan A. is married and the father of 4 children. Although he is primarily a farmer, he also raises animals, a sideline which he feels passionate about. Selling animals he has raised is his special source of income. However, he raises his animals in the traditional fashion, which does not provide much in the way of financial return. Interested in modernizing his operation so as to earn more from it, Ramazan would like to build a pen for his animals and also add other sheep to his flocks. Accomplishing this will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to develop his business

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K., 49, pictured here with her husband, has a business selling palm sugar to earn a living, and she is able to make US$ 12 in revenue per day. Every day, she purchases raw palm juice and refines it to palm sugar. She then sells it to the market-wholesaler.

Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells yams. On average, he makes around US$ 1.50 in profit a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are employed and one in school.

Mrs. Men is asking for a loan to buy more palm juice so she can make more palm sugar to sell at the market.

loans.use: palm juice

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom B. is a young married man and the father of two children. He travels to the different flea markets in the region in search of cattle to purchase, which he then sells at the “Vahdat” market and also sells them wholesale to butchers. Bahrom now needs a loan of 2000 Somoni, which he plans to use to purchase more cattle. His dreams are to improve his business, establish his own wealth, and improve his home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for his business

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina K. is a 54-year-old widow who sells perfume in a small shop and works as a teacher in the local school. She has one son who is her reason for living. Eight years ago, Sakina`s husband passed away, leaving her with no means of support, but she did not give up during this difficult time.

Instead, Sakina decided to open her own store with the help of her parents. Her dream is to provide her son with an excellent education and to pass her business along to him.

Sakina is interested in expanding her main financial source by purchasing more perfume and cosmetics for her store. She is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. Let's help this brave woman to make her dream come true.

loans.use: Purchase more perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Kul

texts.en:
Kul S., 48, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She makes about $7 per day by growing yams and selling them in the market, while her husband earns around US$ 15 by working as a taxi-driver. She and her husband have five children, four who are employed as taxi drivers and one who is in school.

Mrs. Kul S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a small truck for her husband to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: purchase a truck for transport

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa P. is from Pandan, Antique. She belongs to Mag-aba Center 21, a group organized by ASHI. She is blessed with 7 children and married to a fisherman.

She started vending food to crewmen of boats docked in their village. Later on she decided to set up a food stall so that she can be more accessible to her growing customers, which also include the students.  She is requesting for a loan of PhP 5,000 to increase her working capital in her food vending business.
  
Mrs. P. plans to have a small restaurant in their place. She also dreams that someday through her business, her children will finish their studies and also be able to renovate their house.  Through  ASHI she realized that she has already overcome her fear of socializing with other people. She also became a member of Philhealth (a healthplan program of the government).

loans.use: Food Vending

loans.name: Kabul

texts.en:
M. Kabul is a hardworking father with the responsibility of taking care of his wife and two children, the driving force for his work. Early every morning, David leaves to take care of his farmland, irrigating and fertilizing in order to produce quality crops that will earn a good income. His wife and children also help him with his business. 

One of this couple’s dreams is to enable both of their children to achieve higher educations so that one day they’ll become great persons. To that end, they are requesting the current loan to increase their crop production by buying seed, fertilizer and other supplies needed for productive farming of their land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for the farm.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng T. is 59 years old and has a business selling grocery items to the people in the community to earn about US$ 3 in profit every day. She has one child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 1.50 in profit per day. Her child is a worker and makes US$ 2 a day. She would like request a loan of US$ 300 to expand her grocery store by adding more goods to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: supplies for grocery store

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon K., 52, is married and lives with one of her daughters in Kampong Cham, Cambodia She sells cake on campus at a nearby school and makes US$ 5 per day. Her daughter is a university student and is pictured here. She has a small business selling grocery items when she is free from her studies. On average, she makes US$ 3 every day.

Mrs. Suon K. is asking for a loan to expand her daughter’s grocery store.

loans.use: expanding grocery store

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat S. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She and her husband, together, put all their effort toward working very hard on a farm growing rice and a variety of fresh vegetables. Early every morning, the couple’s children collect the produce and sell it at a market. Currently, Sharofat is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm. You are the one who will determine their success and play an important role in their business’s growth!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Мамадчонова Гульчехра девушка 20 лет не замужем.Она живёт с родителями.Гульчехра помогает продавать веники на базаре г.Худжанда.Привозит товар её мать.Гульчехра не может получить высшее образование т.к. их семейный доход хватает на прожиточный минимум.Поэтому благодаря своему бизнесу она поддерживает семейные расходы и проживание.Для увеличения оборота Гульчехра хочет получить кредит
texts.en:
Gulchehra M. is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents. She helps sell brooms at a market in Khujand. Her mother delivers the products. Gulchehra is unable to obtain a higher education because her family’s income is only enough for minimal living expenses. Thanks to her business, she can help with the family’s expenses. She wants to use this loan to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim Y., 49, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She grows and sells rice at the market and makes US$ 4.5 per day, while her husband works collecting palm juice and refines it to sugar palm. On average, he makes US$ 1.50 a day. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is in school and one who works collecting palm juice like her husband as well.

Mrs. Yim Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a tractor to plow her farmland. She will also rent the machine to other farmers for additional profit to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy a tractor

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam S. is a 32-year-old widow who has operated a beauty salon for about 3 years. She is a wedding planner who arranges clothes for groom and bride. On average, she earns about US$ 2 in profit per day. Her business is lucrative in the period spanning November to April, the wedding season. She has one child who just began school. She would like to take out a loan of US$ 400 to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor T. is 40 years old. She is married with two children. For almost 2 years, Gulbahor has been working as a market vendor. She sells plates and dishes in the oriental style. This kind of the goods is in popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for girls' dowry and also for family celebrations. The love for her children is the biggest reason for Sharofat to make an effort to provide what they need.

Now Sharofat is planning to enlarge her range of goods and to purchase the china for re-sale. With this purpose she is requesting 3500 Somoni (950 USD) for a term of 12 months. The well-being of Sharofat’s family and her business are in your hands. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  plates and dishes for re-sale

loans.name: Obloior

texts.en:
Obloior is married and the father of two children. He has a large and friendly family including: his wife, children, mother and brother. For 5 years, he has been engaged in a farming business. The love for his children is the motivator that keeps him working hard for their future. He works fast together with the help of his brother to achieve quality produce.

The high price of fertilizer has caused his production to slow down; he wishes to do better, have more production and increase the number of hectares with crops. To do that, Obloior needs capital, which he is requesting through a loan and hopes that you can help him. This way he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes cloth for resale

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Babek A. is a young and energetic man of 23. He is single and lives with his parents who are on pension now. Babek has been running a store for the last two years, which is the main source of income for the family. He sells different kind of goods such as tooth paste, soup, cosmetics, deodorants, and other items.

Babek finished his studies at the university, but he could not find a job appropriate to his profession. His father gave him a small amount of money to start his own business. Babek took the opportunity to start selling products in high demand among the local people. Now he has about 2000 USD of stock in his store. Babek wants to start his own family this year, so he needs to increase his income. Babek has applied for a 1200 USD loan for the term of 14 months. He appreciates your help.

loans.use: Purchase different types of products for his store

loans.name: Uma

texts.en: Miss Uma N. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made items, vegetable sales, utensils of different metals, and so on. The area is a very busy shopping center. Miss N. lives with her father, mother and brothers. Five years ago Miss N. opened her beauty parlor to upgrade her family's standard of living. She took 6 months of training for beauty parlor work from the local training institute. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting Rs30,000.00 to buy various types of makeup supplies for her work. She wishes to use her income to further raise the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy makeup supplies

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Née en 1951 à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame N. Ayaba a pour activité principale  la vente des poissons fumés. Avec six personnes en charge, elle vit au jour le jour avec les maigres recettes de son activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans avec un système traditionnel qui consiste à prendre le poisson à crédit chez les pêcheurs et payer ces derniers après la vente. Ce qui ne lui permet de faire une bonne affaire et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
L’expérience de tontine et de crédit qu’elle a entreprises lui donne peu à peu une autonomie financière et c’est dans le but de payer désormais comptant les poissons, multiplier sa production et augmenter ses recettes qu’elle sollicite un crédit  pour fabriquer de nouveaux fours et grilles nécessaires à la réussite de ses activités. Le financement de ce projet contribuera  à réduire sensiblement l’état de misère de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1951 in Agbanakin in the Lacs prefecture, Madame Ayaba N.’s main line of business is selling smoked fish. She is responsible for six people, and she lives from hand to mouth on the meager income generated by the business that she has run for the last 20 years. She uses the traditional system of buying fish on credit from the fishermen and paying them back after selling the fish. This is not a good deal for her and does not allow her to support her family. Her experience with tontines(a group savings/investment system) and loans has, little by little, given her some financial independence. Her aim from now on is to pay for the fish with cash, increase her fish production and thus her income. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy the new ovens and grills she needs to make her business a success. The financing of this project will considerably reduce her family's poverty.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell smoked fish

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod M., 32, is married and has 4 children. He lives in Istaravshan town and works with his brother in agriculture. Five years ago, he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Farhod grows potatoes and onions, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy inputs that will enable him to improve production yield. Farhod has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Dunyakhanum

texts.en:
Dunyakhanum M. is a 52-year-old woman who runs a retail shop where she sells bath accessories. She started this business more than 10 years ago when her husband passed away, and she was left alone to raise her young son.

Now her son is grown, and Dunyakhanum is paying for his studies at the university. It is very hard to cover all his expenses, and she has no hope that someone will help her. Dunyakhanum realizes that it is solely her responsibility to pay for his education. She would like to expand her business for this purpose, so she has applied for a 1200 USD loan. Dunyakhanum is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase bath accessories for her shop

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Née en 1977 à d'Agbanakin (P/des Lacs) , Madame K. Akouavi est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari  étant sans activité stable, il n'arrive pas à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Mme KP0NOR s'est donc lancée dans l’achat  des noix de palme dans les fermes et villages environnants qu’elle revend sur les marchés de la place afin de supporter les charges familiales. 
Aujourd'hui, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en grande quantité  en noix de palme. Ce qui lui permettra de réaliser des revenus conséquents et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Agbanakin (in the Lacs prefecture), Madame Akouavi K. is married and has three children. Her husband does not have steady work, so he cannot provide for the family. Madame K. has therefore undertaken to buy palm nuts in the nearby farms and villages, which she then sells in marketplaces in order to pay the family expenses. She is now requesting a loan that will allow her to stock up with palm nuts in bulk. This will generate more income and allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Tochi

texts.ru: Бобочонова Точи успешно закончив свой очередной займ хочет снова получить кредит.Она своевременно погашала свои погашения.Займы помогли ей увеличить оборотный капитал.Благодаря этому она смогла в этом году устроить свою дочь в университет.Также у неё улучшилось семейное положение.
texts.en:
Tochi B. just successfully repaid her last loan and wants to obtain new credit. She timely repaid all her previous loans. The loans helped her to increase return profits. Thanks to this, Tochi has been able to enroll her daughter in a university. Her family situation has also improved.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of towels and table clothes

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim O. is a 34-year-old businessman. He is married, and he and his wife have three children. All their children are studying at the local school. Salim is a farmer, like his wife. They started their work 10 years ago. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife, he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land.

His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the city. Salim is requesting the loan for the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, fuel and lubricants. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya T. is engaged in making glass-beaded bracelets and necklaces for the ladies. In Nepal, most of the married women wear these types of adornments. She sells these products in a cosmetics shop. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years. For her business, she is requesting her first loan of Rs10,000.00 to buy raw materials for her work.

Mrs. T. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Ganesh T., is a retired officer. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 11 as well as working in a finance company. Both her sons are now working. Nowadays her work is popular among the married women in her area, Thikedewal.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.en:
Alimardon J. is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and in future be able to send his dearest little daughter to school. Farming has been his major source of income. Alimardon produces rice once a year. In spite of the expensive farm inputs, merchants buy their rice at a lower price. Because of this, Alimardon is requesting a loan of 700 USD to support his farming business and to avoid asking for credits from merchants who charge higher interest.

Alimardon is grateful that he is able to borrow from lenders that offer small interest and create better opportunities in their lives - thus helping their family to be free from poverty. Alimardon said that through prayers and hard work, his dreams can be achieved someday. Providing his daughter with education is one of the important things that Alimardon prioritizes.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tika Shari

texts.en:
Tika Shari R. lives in Thikedewal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and four children. She has three sons and one daughter. All her children are now students. Her husband, Mr. Bhakta R., is in Saudi Arabia to work.

Mrs. Tika Shari R. is engaged in handicraft work. She makes different types of felt items, such as doormats, place mats, sweaters, caps and bags. She took two months of training to start her work. She sells her products in handicraft shops. Now she is requesting Rs10,000.00 to buy various raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab R. is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Zeynab sells women's underwear, cosmetics, and other items. She started her business six years ago when her husband lost his job, and her family was without any source of income. Zeynab and her husband both run the business, but Zeynab spends more time at the store because her husband found a new job. However, the store still provides their main source of income.

Zeynab applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase more inventory in the hopes that it will increase her income. This will help improve her family's living conditions and allow her to save money for her children's education. Zeynab and her family are counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia C.,72, comes from Hamtic, Antique and is blessed with 8 children. She is a member of Banawon 24 in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc (ASHI) Antique Southwest Branch. She is a perservering woman because even at her advanced age she is still working hard for the betterment of her businesses. 
	
She is engaged in hog fattening and tends a variety store at the same time.  She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to get a loan. The businesses are a big help for the family to cover their expenses and to set aside savings for the future. Mrs. C.  is requesting a loan of PhP 10,000 for  additional capital for her variety store and to purchase one more piglet. 
	
She dreams that someday her variety store will become a grocery someday. She wants to thank ASHI for giving them an initial capital for her business and for micro-insurance, training and compulsory savings for the members  that ASHI has innovated.

loans.use: Variety Store & Hog Fattening

loans.name: Berdi

texts.en:
Berdi J. is 58 years old and a resident of Aktepa province in Sugd region where he has owned a plot of land since 1984. He grows rice, which he plants twice a year. He is married and a good father of three children. His wife is a teacher in the local school.

To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, two of his older children are working with him. Rice growing is the main source of income to sustain this family. Berdi is applying for a 700 USD loans to buy seeds and fertilizer. This loan will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Саидов Баходур проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 29 лет. Женат , имеет двоих детей. Работает парикмахером уже семь лет. Его салон находится в центре города. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить машинку и другой инвентарь , необходимый для его дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahodur S. lives in Vahdat. He is 27 years old, is married and has two children. He has been working as a hairdresser for seven years now. His salon is located at the center of the city. He plans to take out a loan in order to buy a machine and other inventory necessary for his craft. He will be able to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine and necessary inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and hair extensions

loans.name: Padma

texts.en:
Padma R. is a resident of Thikedewal, located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses. She has two daughters. Her older daughter is a student in grade 5, and her younger daughter is in primary school.

Mrs. R. and her husband, Mr. Pashupati R., opened their grocery shop 6 years ago. They sell different types of grocery items, such as rice, maize, noodles and so on.  Now Mrs. R. is requesting a loan of Rs10,000.00 to buy different types of grocery items for her business. She wants to use her increased income to provide a better education to her daughters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru: Тутинисо женщина 47 лет ,замужем, имеет четверых детей. Уже пятый год занимается бизнесом продажей хозтоваров.Тутинисо полностью своё время уделяет своему бизнесу.У неё договорённость с фирмами которые сами поставляют её товар.В её ассортимент входят вся химия для чистки и уборки дома.Тутинисо планирует взяв кредит увеличить свой ларёк и ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Tutiniso is 47 years old, married and has four children. This is her fifth year in the business of selling household products, and she devotes all of her time to the business. She has agreements with delivery companies to bring her products. Among others, her goods assortment includes products for cleaning a house. Tutiniso plans to obtain this loan to expand her store and increase goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household products

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina J. is a 22-year-old mother and lives with her husband. They both work very hard and Madina just gave birth to a new baby. She and her husband make a living by planting and cultivating crops such as: rice, corn, and other grains in their field. This couple is striving to work all day and into the night in their field plowing, cultivating, and fertilizing soil to grow more crops due to a great demand in the market. They hope to use the loan to make more and better quality crops and in the end to earn worthy money.

In the future, they hope to save more money to buy one more land so they can grow a wider range of crops for additional income. Madina hopes one day she will have enough money to send her children to a local school.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en:
Alaga A. is a 50-year-old man who sells spare parts for Russian and foreign cars. He is married and has four children.

Alaga started his business more than 12 years ago when he lost his job. Alaga is a very polite and friendly man, that’s why his shop is always full of people. Alaga applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase more spare parts for his store.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts for his store

loans.name: Faiziddin

texts.ru: Шарипов Файзиддин житель города Вахдат. Возраст 26 лет, холост. Имеет высшее образование. Но по профессии не работает. Занимается бизнесом. Имеет продуктовый магазин . Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.  У Файзиддина большой ассортимент товара, но тем не менее он хочет увеличить товарооборот , чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Faiziddin S. lives in Vahdat. He is 26 years old and is a bachelor. He has a college education, but does not work in his profession. He works in business and owns a food store. He has been in this business for 10 years now. Faiziddin plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He will be able to pay back the loan over 18 months. Faiziddin has a large product assortment, nonetheless he would like to increase his inventory in order to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Binita

texts.en: Mrs. Binita B. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She has one son who attends pre-primary school. Both Mrs. B. and her husband, Mr. Jay Raj B., are engaged in making traditional stone statues. They make different types of the traditional stone idols, made to meet the demands of their customers. Nowadays in that area, the demand for idols is increasing, so to meet the demand they need to invest in their business. However, due to a lack of funds they are unable to do this. So Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000.00 to buy supplies, like stones and tools, for the idol-making work.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her work

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti K. has two sons who attend middle and high school. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law and mother-in-law. Jayanti already owns one cow, and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal, pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.

Jayanti lives in a growing neighborhood, and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door to door, daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase the milk production.  So she is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000.00 to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows.  She has grassland of her own, so she does not have to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a jersey cow

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Ахмедов Рахим проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет , женат  имеет троих детей. Уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом . Торгует на центральном рынке города. Торгует обувью. Товар поставляет сам из города ДУшанбе. Его  бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Бизнес дает доход , которого хватает для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Теперь он хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahim A. lives in the town of Vakhdat. He is 46 years old and is married with three children. He has 15 years of business experience. He brings shoes from Dushanbe and sells them at Vakhdat's central market. His business is his family's main source of income, and it is profitable enough for supporting the whole family. Now Rahim would like get a loan in order to increase cash flow. He would pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Mrs. Tara D., 31 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kritpur.  She opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which is very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs D. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her home.
She plans to use the Rs. 20,000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self-improvement and for her son’s education. In Nepal, the cost of good education is increasing, and Mrs. D. is saving her income to provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Yormahmad

texts.ru: Эшонов Ермахмад житель Шахринау. Живет в селе . Работает таксистом , на своем автомобиле по маршруту Шахринау - Душанбе.  Занимается  этим уже 6 лет.  Возраст 25 лет, женат , детей не имеет. В данный момент он остался без работы , так произошла поломка двигателя. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для его ремонта. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yormahmad A. lives in Shahrinaw, in the village. He is a taxi driver, using his own vehicle to drive the Shahrinaw - Dushanbe route. This has been his work for the past 6 years. He is 25 years old, married, and has no children. Right now he has no work because the vehicle's engine failed. He would like a loan in order to do the needed repairs. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle engine repairs

loans.name: Tari Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tari Maiya D., a resident of Chappagaun, lives with her husband and two sons. Chappagaun is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband works in a private office. Her older son has a small business, and her younger son is in grade 10.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming. Now she has four goats on her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrade the living standard of her family. Now she is requesting a third loan of Rs. 20,000.00 to buy a few more goats and grains to feed them.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Mina Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina Thapa M. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. Mrs. Thapa M. is married and has two children. Her daughter is studying for her BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies), and her son is studying in grade 11.

Mr. and Mrs. Thapa M. operate a small food shop, which they opened four years ago. They sell a variety of food items, including Nepali food such as dalbhat (rice). They also sell tea and coffee. The demand for their services is increasing. They already cleared their previous loan from Kiva. Therefore, Mrs. Thapa M. is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000.00 to buy the necessary ingredients to make more food.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Hairullo

texts.ru: Пайзиев Хайрулло житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 58 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей.Работает в "Талко". Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы использовать его в потребительских целях. У него есть недостроенный дом. Поэтому полученный кредит использует для покупки стройматериалов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hairullo P. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 58 years old, married, and has four children. He works for the company Talko. He decided to take out a loan for personal use. He has an uncompleted house, and the loan would be used to buy construction materials. The loan will be repaid over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. O. is a 28-year-old man living in the Nyalenda neighborhood in Kisumu, Kenya with his wife and two children. George moved to Kisumu after the post-election violence in the Central Province of Kenya displaced him from his home there. He has been living in Kisumu for one year and has recently started a poultry business.

George is a boda-boda driver, which means he is the driver of a bicycle taxi (a common, inexpensive mode of transport in Kisumu). Looking to increase his income, George wanted to start a small business that would be easy to maintain while he continued his boda-boda work. He decided on a poultry business, since after feeding and giving water to the chickens he would be free to work during the day.

A new member to the K-MET network, George was interested in becoming one of K-MET’s Community Health Workers so that he could “help the people near him who need assistance.” He also found out about K-MET’s micro-finance program and is now applying for a loan of approximately 150 USD in order to expand his poultry business.

George has 15 chickens at present and sells the eggs to his neighbors. He would like to use the loan money to purchase about 150 chickens. After expanding the number of poultry, he will be able to expand his sales, perhaps getting a stall in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase chickens to raise

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline F. A. is a new member of the K-MET network. She will soon be trained as a Community Health Worker by K-MET and will begin visiting patients in her community. She joined when she was told that along with volunteering, she would be eligible for a loan.

Jackline is 31, married to a driver, and the mother of 2 children – a boy and a girl, ages 11 and 9, who are both currently in school. The family lives in Molem, a village just outside of Kisumu, Kenya.

Jackline has a business selling second-hand clothing in Kibuye Market, the major market in Kisumu. Jackline buys her stock from the wholesalers in the same market. She started the business in 2007, when she decided she wanted to be able to better provide for her children.

She is applying for her first loan from K-MET, of approximately 400 USD. Jackline will use the loan money to buy clothing in bales from the wholesalers, as it is cheaper to buy in bulk than by the piece.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Ahmatjon

texts.ru: Бокиев Ахматджон житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем такси. Автомобиль на котором он работает в данный момент арендованная. Сейчас он планирует покупку собственного автомобиля для дальнейшей работы таксистом. Но у него не  хватает денег . Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Если у него будет своя машина , ему не придеться платить аренду и он будет зарабатывать больше.
texts.en:
Ahmatjon B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He completed secondary education, and works as a taxi driver. He is currently using a rented vehicle for his work. He is planning to buy his own vehicle to drive as a taxi, but he doesn't have enough money, so he decided to take out a 12 month loan. By using his own vehicle he will be able to avoid paying rent, and thus earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle purchase

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne A. O. is a 27-year-old married mother of 2, a girl of 1 year and 3 months and a boy of 4 years. She lives in the Nyamasaria district of Kisumu, Kenya. Anne recently joined the K-MET network to become a volunteer Community Health Worker in her neighborhood. This makes her eligible for a K-MET loan.

Anne has a small business selling net curtains and sheets in the Kibuye Market on Sunday, the main market day, and door-to-door on other days. She started this business in 1990. It was in that year that Anne decided that her former business of selling vegetables was not earning enough profit, so she switched to selling curtains. P> One of the challenges of the business is that sometimes Anne will deliver an item without having received payment – this prevents her from buying more stock until she can get the payment from the customer. Anne is applying for a loan of approximately 275 USD from K-MET in order to increase her stock of curtains and sheets.

loans.use: To purchase curtains and sheets

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame Mariame Koné est une  veuve de 52 ans qui vit avec ses  7 enfants  dans la maison de son feu mari à Loulouni ville(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Mariame Koné est matrône au centre de santé de Loulouni. En plus de cette activité d’auxilliaire d’agent de santé elle mène avec harmonie une  activité de commerce à savoir l’achat et la vente du bois de chauffe. Pour se faire, elle a acheté 2 ânes, une charrette et utilise le service d’un charretier (qui s’occupe du transport de bois de chauffe et de sa distribution). 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Mariame Koné compte acheter  avec ce prêt, 18 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne à Loulouni et environs et vend généralement sur commande et en détail, la plupart au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.000FCFA dont la plus grande partie sera épargnée. Elle ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariame Koné is a widow, 52 years of age, who lives with her seven children in her late husband's house in Loulouni City (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is the matron of the Loulouni health center. In addition to this work as the assistant health representative, she harmoniously works in commerce, namely buying and selling firewood. To do so, she bought two donkeys and a cart, and she uses the services of a carter (whose business is to transport firewood and distribute it).

In order to satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her fifth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans on using this loan to buy 18 cart-loads of firewood. Supplies are gotten in and around Loulouni and are generally sold by special order and at the retail level, mostly in cash, to customers composed of women and men.

She envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA, most of which will be put into savings. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Rahmat Elahi M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Rahmat Elahi baji is a 44-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to their meager financial resources. She is married to a man whose name is M. M., and he is a delivery man by profession. He delivers various items, specially fruits & vegetables, from one place to another.

Rahmat baji is the mother of six children: three boys and three girls. Her first two sons work in a workshop where they repair motorbikes and earn money on a monthly basis. Her younger son is a mason by trade. Her daughters stay home and don’t have jobs.

Rahmat baji is a very responsible lady. She shares the financial burden of her husband by preparing embroidered dresses. She collects order from her relatives and her neighbors. She charges US$ 3 per embroidered dress. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because their old cart has become worn out.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business. Shakeela Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy electric wire to sell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. O. is a 27-year-old married mother of three. She lives in Molem, a small village just outside of Kisumu, Kenya. She recently joined K-MET to become a volunteer Community Health Worker. As a part of the K-MET network, she is now eligible for a loan to help her business.

Esther sells vegetables in her neighborhood in Molem – items such as kale, cabbage, potatoes, cassava as well as "omena", a small sardine-like fish. She started this business in January of 2008. Previously she had been working as a seamstress, but decided she wanted to add to her income.

Now, Esther does commission-based sewing when she is not running her vegetable business. She would like to build a stall to sell her produce from, so Esther has applied for a K-MET loan of approximately 275 USD in order to purchase the construction materials and build the stall.

loans.use: To purchase stall building materials

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame  Sadio S. a 50 ans et vit à Gongebougou  un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo(Sikasso:troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali) avec ses 4 enfants et son époux  dans une famille traditionnelle élargie. 
Madame Sadio S. n’a pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle a appris à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère depuis l’enfance. Aguérrie par des années passées avec  de sa maman très expérimentée, elle mène  aujourd’hui son activité de commerce en compagnie de son mari lui même commerçant. 
Après trois prêts individuels tous correctements remboursés, elle est à son 4eme prêt individuel.
Madame Sadio S. compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 sacs de maïs et 15 sacs de sorgho. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environants de Loulouni et de Nimbougou. Elle les revend au comptant aux marchés de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni à une clientèle composée généralement d’hommes. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Sadio S. is 50 years old and lives in Gongebougou, a village in Kadiolo prefecture (Sikasso: third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) with her four children and spouse in a traditional extended family. She did not go to school for social reasons. During her childhood, she learned from her mother how to work in small-scale commerce. Battle-hardened through the years with her well-experienced mother, she now carries out her work in the company of her husband, a merchant himself.

After three individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is on her fourth one. She plans to use this loan to buy 15 sacks of corn and 15 sacks of sorghum. Supplies are gotten in the surrounding villages of Loulouni and Nimbougou. The goods are sold in cash at the marketplaces of Dallen, Nimbougou, and Loulouni, to customers composed generally of men.

She envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA that will be used for the most part to augment her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain (corn and sorghum)

loans.name: Rajabbi

texts.ru: Юлдошева Раджабби живет в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 53 года, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Работает поваром в столовой. Помещение арендует. Данный бизнес работает уже 10 лет. Теперь для того, чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания , она планирует получить кредит и закупить новую посуду  и скатерти. Это поможет привлечь новых клиент.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabbi U. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She is a cook with a cafe. The facility is rented. The cafe has been in business for 10 years. In order to improve service, she decided to request a loan to buy new dishes and tablecloths. This will help attract new customers. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dishes and tablecloths

loans.name: Zahida M. Yaseen Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is a 37-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Paksitan for the last 17 years. Her husband's name is M. Y. and he has a livestock business. He buys livestock (goats and sheep) from the animal market and sells them to the butcher shop. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years.

Zahida baji is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which located near their house. Zahida baji is a very hard-working lady. She knows the value of hard work. She keeps herself busy sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and her relatives. She does this work to pay the school fees of her kids. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy livestock to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Taj baji wants a loan to buy repair-tools for her workshop. Amna baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Another Amna baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Everlyne Susan

texts.en:
Everlyne Susan A. A. is a 29-year-old married mother of two. She lives with her family in the small village of Molem, just outside of Kisumu, Kenya. Everlyne has recently joined the K-MET network of volunteer Community Health Workers. As such, she is eligible for a loan from the K-MET micro-finance department.

In 2005 Everlyne started a business selling maize on the street. She used to be a maid in a private home, but decided that she would rather be her own boss. Selling maize is a fairly easy business and it gives her money for her children’s school fees and lunches.

Everlyne is applying for a loan of approximately 550 USD in order to buy sacks of maize from the wholesalers who travel through town.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. O. is a recent addition to the team of K-MET volunteer Community Health Workers (CHWs). As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Eunice is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She lives in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu, Kenya. In 2008 she started a vegetable stall in her neighborhood, after switching from a tailoring business she had started in 2005. The tailoring business was not doing well, so she decided to start selling vegetables, which has since proved to be profitable. She sells kale, cabbage, tomatoes, as well as fruit, chips (French fries), and kerosene.

Eunice has applied for a loan of approximately 150 USD; she will use this money to boost her business by adding stock of vegetables and other various items.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other items

loans.name: Samaat Salamat Abdul Aziz Group

texts.en:
Samaat Salamat baji is a 39-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Her husband's name is A. A. and he is a delivery man by trade. He delivers various items, e.g. construction supplies and fruits & vegetables, from one place to another. He delivers the items on his donkey cart. He has been doing this work for the past 10 years.

Samaat baji is a very hard-working lady. She has a buffalo at her house. She gets up early and gets milk from her buffalo and sells it in different milk shops and earns income. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become worn out.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit-selling business. Anwar baji and Majida baji each want a loan to buy livestock (goats) to sell. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Assétou Koné a 46 ans et vit avec ses trois  enfants et son époux  à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  Assétou Koné s’est initiée à l’activité de stockage et commercialisation des  céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant trois ans. Elle dispose d’un magasin sis au grand marché de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant quatre  ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II), elle est actuellement à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 2 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de sorgho, 2 sacs d’arachide, 2 sacs de riz et 4 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne à Niono (région de Ségou) et dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de  revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Assétou Koné, age 46, lives with her three children and spouse in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she was introduced three years ago to storing and marketing grain (corn, millet, sorghum). She has a store located at the grand marketplace of Sikasso.

Wanting to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. Afer six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area (Association Benkadi de Sanoubougou II), she is now on her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy two sacks of corn, three sacks of sorghum, two of peanuts, two of rice, and four of millet. Supplies are gotten in Niono (Ségou region) and in towns surrounding Sikasso, and then the goods are sold retail to customers composed generally of heads of families.

She envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help cover family expenses, to repay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain (millet, corn, peanuts, sorghum, etc.)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling medicines at the drug shop and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Mary is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a secretary with PSI Sudan. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for the children

loans.name: Sugran Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a 46-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 5 years. Sugran baji is the wife of Mr. Z. I. who has been a cloth merchant for the past 15 years. He buys cloth from the city called Multan and sells it in his native city, Pakpattan. Sugran baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of her kids are getting an education from a school which is located near their house.

Sugran baji is involved in a sewing business. She sews clothes to pay the school fees for her kids because her husband pays all the household expenses. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more cloth to expand her husband’s cloth-selling business. She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy material (razors and chairs) for her salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for their  business

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne M. recently joined the group of K-MET volunteer Community Health Workers (CHWs) in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Everlyne runs a business selling used clothing at the local bus station. Before she began this business in 2006, Everlyne was working as a receptionist in town. She saw it was necessary to run her own business where she is independent and can make her decisions alone.

She buys her inventory at Kibuye Market in Kisumu. Everlyne mainly sells girls' dresses, though she would like to expand into selling bags, both school bags and ladies' bags. In order to do this, Everlyne has applied for a loan of approximately 200 USD from K-MET, which she will use to purchase bags.

Everlyne is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children, who are both currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase school bags and purses

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care. 

Rosemary is 22 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She has a fruit and vegetable stall, where she sells sukuma wiki (kale), tomatoes, and fruits, in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu. 

She initiated this business in 2002 in order to enable herself to earn an income to provide for her daily needs.  Rosemary was a primary school drop-out and was finding it difficult to get work, so she decided to start her own business.

She has applied for a loan of $150 USD, which she will use to buy vegetables in bulk in order to maximize her profit.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Сатторова Шарофат проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Работает в столовой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить продукты питания долгого хранения. Это поможет сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию. Кредит планирует погасить в течение 12 месяцев. Шарофат 49 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She works in a cafe, and has been in the business for the past 7 years. She plans to take out a loan to buy foods which keep well in storage. This will help her maintain prices for the the products offered. The loan will be repaid over 12 months. Sharofat is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of preserved foods

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Koné a 43 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant, il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses cadets à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Koné est un chauffeur de profession, parallèlement à son métier il mène l’activité d’achat et de vente des fournitures de bureau et  des meubles de maison depuis maintenant 15 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle  pour la qualité de ses produits.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre  mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel .
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 4 armoires, 4 lits, 2 bibliothèques, etc. Il achète ses marchandises au cours de ses voyages en Côte d’Ivoire et au Togo avant de les revendre à la demande de sa clientèle.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et rembourser les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Koné, age 43, is unmarried and the father of a child. He lives in a large traditional family with his younger siblings in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a driver by trade. Along with this work, he has been buying and selling office supplies and home furniture for fifteen years. He is in high demand by his customers for the quality of his goods.
