TIENE 5 CINCO HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 4 ESTUDIAN EN COLEGIO DE CONVENIO Y SU ESPOSA EN OCASIONES VENDE MASITAS Y SALADITOS EN EL COLEGIO DE SUS HIJOS. EL TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 10 AÑOS EN SU TRABAJO, POR LO QUE CONOCE MUY BIEN SU ACTIVIDAD. SI BIEN NO TIENE ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES, SABE A CABALIDAD INTERPRETAR PLANOS DE CONSTRUCCION. EN NUESTRO MEDIO EXITEN MUCHAS PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN A ESTE TIPO DE TRABAJO, PERO ÉL TIENE PERSONAS CONOCIDAS QUE SIEMPRE LO CONTRATAN PARA DIFENRETES TIPOS DE TRABAJO DE CONSTRUCCION. DE ACUERDO A LA DIMENSION A CONSTRUIR Y SI ES CON OBRA FINA INCLUIDA DIFIERE EL PRECIO DE LA REALIZACION DE UNA VIVIENDA. ACTUALMENTE ESTA TRABAJANDO EN EL CAMPO REALIZANDO UNA CHURRASQUERA EN LA PROVINCIA DE SAN JAVIER. TIENE BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE CREDITO YA QUE SOLO TRABAJA CON AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
Jose, age 38, works independently in civil construction and works with private employers. He has 5 children, 4 of whom attend a school sponsored jointly by the church and the government, and his wife sometimes sells snacks at the children’s school. Jose has 10 years of experience in his line of work so he is very familiar with his field. Even though he did not complete higher education, he is very experienced in reading construction plans. In our area there are many people who work in this field, but Jose has many business contacts who always hire him for different construction jobs. The cost of building a house differs based on the size and whether detailed finishing is included in the job. Right now Jose is working in the countryside building a barbeque restaurant in the province of San Javier. He has good credit history since he only works with the Agrocapital organization.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cement mixer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and use a mill

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou a 46 ans elles est mariée .Elle a 5 enfants  qui vivent avec elle dans la maison conjugale.Depuis plus 8 ans codou se léve chaque matin pour aller au marché vendre des légumes.Avec  les revenus de son peitit commerce qu' elle a demarré sur fonds propres ,codou aide son mari pour les depenses du menage elle paye les frais medicaux et/ou de scolarité de ses enfants.Avec le pret sollicité elle veut renforcer son activité par l'achat de quantité plus importantes de machandises pour satisfaire la demende de ses clients.
texts.en:
Codou is 46 years old, married, and has five children who live with her in a conjugal house. For eight years, she has been getting up each morning to go to the market to sell vegetables. With the revenues from her small-scale commerce, which she started with her own capital, she helps her husband with household expenses. She covers the medical and/or schooling costs for the children. With this loan being requested, she wants to bolster her business by buying even larger quantities of merchandise in order to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Ruth is 32, married, and has 4 boys who are all attending school. She joined K-MET in order to work with her community.

Ruth is an onion seller in Kibuye Market in Kisumu. She has been selling there since 1996. Before deciding to start a business selling onions, Ruth was not working. She chose onions because they are an easy product to get. Ruth purchases her stock of onions by the sack daily from wholesalers in Kibuye Market.

Ruth has applied for a loan from K-MET of approximately $150. She plans to use the money to buy a larger stock of onions; the price has risen recently due to the drought conditions in Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase onions

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es: MARIA TIENE HIJOS INDEPENDIENTES, ELLA TRABAJA SOLA. TIENE CASA PROPIA UBICADA EN LA ZONA DE TICTI NORTE. LA CLIENTE TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE PREPARACION Y VENTAS DE COMIDAS, ELLA PREPARA ALMUERZOS Y PLATOS EXTRAS, TIENE LA VENTAJA QUE FRENTE A SU DOMICILIO, SE ENCUENTRA LA PARADA FINAL DE UN TRUFI (bus). TAMBIEN CUENTA CON UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU MISMA CASA. LA COMPETENCIA DE MARIA ES MINIMA DEBIDO A QUE NO EXISTE OTROS PUESTOS QUE VENDEN COMIDA A LOS CHOFERES DE LOS TRUFIS, ASI MISMO LA TIENDA DE BARRIO SE ENCUENTRA BIEN SURTIDA Y TIENE CLIENTES ESTABLES. CON EL CREDITO OBTENIDO LA CLIENTE PLANEA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES TANTO DEL PUESTO DE COMIDAS COMO DE LA TIENDA DE BARRIO. MARIA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA TERCERA SECUENCIA. SE TRATA DE UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE QUIEN CANCELO EL ANTERIOR CREDITO SIN PROBLEMAS. TUVO CIERTOS RETRASOS, PERO ESTOS NO FUERON SIGNIFICATIVOS.
texts.en:
Maria has grown up children and she works alone. She owns her own house in the North Ticti area. Maria has her own business preparing and selling food, lunches, and extra dishes. She has an advantage in her business because in front of her house is the final stop of a bus line. She also runs a small neighborhood store from her house. Her competition is quite low because there are no other stalls selling food to the bus drivers, and her store has a wide variety of goods and a stable client base. With this loan Maria plans to increase the working capital for her food stall as well as for her corner store. This is Maria’s third loan cycle. She is a very responsible person who has repaid the previous loans without problems. She had a few late repayments but the delays were not significant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital and Repayment of Agrocapital Loan

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de quarante neuf (49) ans, Mme Ablavi W. est marié avec cinq (05) personnes à charge. Elle exerce comme activité la production et la vente de l’huile de palme depuis plus de douze (12) ans. C’est une activité dans laquelle elle excelle et qui lui procure suffisamment de revenus pour les besoins de sa famille. Actuellement la matière première (noix de palme) qui entre dans la fabrication de l’huile abonde sur le marché et Mme Ablavi sollicite un crédit pour constituer un stock important de matière en vue de produire et de stocker d’huile qu’elle va revendre au moment où les prix vont augmenter sur le marché. Cela lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ablavi W., age 49, is married and has five people in her care. Her work has involved the making and selling of palm oil for over twelve years. This is a business in which she excels and that brings in sufficient income for family needs. Currently, the raw materials (palm nuts) used for making the oil are abundant on the market. And she is requesting a loan to build a sizable stock in order to produce and store oil, which she is going sell when market prices rise. This will enable her to grow her revenues and to improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making and selling palm oil

loans.name: Kodjo Edem

texts.fr: A. kodjo edem habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il a une boutique qu’il apelle EZEK dans laquelle il fait le commerce de matelas, cousins, appareils electro menagers, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit d’un montant de 500000 pour augmenter son stock avec des matelas coussins et appareils electro ménagers. il est marié et père d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Kodjo Edem A. lives in the Adidogomé district. He has a shop that he calls “EZEK” where he does commerce in mattresses, cushions, and household appliances. He has never been a recipient of a loan from WAGES and is requesting his first loan in the amount of 500,000 francs. The loan will used to increase his stock of these goods. He is married and a father with one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mattresses, cushions, and household appliances

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE LA SEGUNDINA ESTA COMPUESTA POR 3 MIEMBROS (ELLA Y DOS HIJOS) EL ESPOSO SE ENCUENTRA EN ARGENTINA, LOS HIJOS AUN SON DEPENDIENTES, SE ENCUENTRAN ESTUDIANDO. SEGUNDINA VIVE EN LA ZONA DE CRUCE TAQUIÑA. SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION Y ARREGLO DE TRAJES EN GENERAL, TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, TAMBIEN TIENE INSTALADO UN PUNTO INTERNET EN SU DOMICILIO. LO CUAL MEJORA SUS INGRESOS. LA COMPETENCIA DE SEGUNDINA ES MODERADA, YA QUE ELLA ES BIEN CONOCIDA POR LA HABILIDAD QUE TIENE PARA LA CONFECCION. TIENE CLIENTES ESTABLES QUE LE ENCARGAN TRAJES A MEDIDA (DAMAS). EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES, SEGUNDINA COMPRARA MATERIALES Y ACCESORIOS NECESARIOS PARA SU NEGOCIO. SE ENCUENTRA EN LA TERCERA SECUENCIA, EL ANTERIOR CREDITO TUVO UN RETRASO DE 1 DIA EN 30 CUOTAS. SE TRATA DE UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
Segundina's family has three members, herself and her two children. Her husband is in Argentina. Her children still live with her and go to school. She lives in the Cruce Taquiña neighborhood and earns her living making and altering dresses; she has a great deal of experience in her field. She also has an internet connection in her house, which increases her income. Segundina has only moderate competition, as she is well known for her dressmaking abilities. She has established clients, ladies who order custom-made dresses. Segundina plans to use her loan as working capital, to buy materials and accessories for her business. This will be her third loan. With her prior loan, out of 30 payments, she was one day late one time. She is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and to pay off her balance with Agrocapital

loans.name: Amistad 5 Group

texts.en:
Group 5 of the Amistad (Friendship) Bank of Hope is now on their 8th loan cycle. Antonia M. S. is the coordinator for this group of five. She has 3 children ages 15, 12 and 9. She started her small business selling only pants.  She has diversified her selection and will use this loan to purchase a larger quantity of items requested by her customers, such as undergarments and sleepwear. She will also add a variety of pants she already offers for sale. Antonia finds it challenging sometimes to understand customers needs as their tastes change from time to time but also knows a good business person can show empathy to customers, put yourself in their place, and find a way to deliver to maintain happy customers. 

She envisions a future where her business continues to grow, her family is well and they all remain in faith. 
On behalf of these entrepreneurs and Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: purchase requested clothing items to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: JUAN TIENE UNA FAMILIA QUE ESTÁ COMPUESTA POR 6 PERSONAS, ÉL SU ESPOSA Y SUS CUATRO HIJOS DE 3,6,8 Y 13 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE. TODOS VIVEN EN DOMICILIO PROPIO EN LA LOCALIDAD. JUAN TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES, DONDE ADMINISTRA POR MUCHOS AÑOS SU ESPOSA. JUAN TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE EQUIPO PESADO EN LA COMUNIDAD, TIENE POCA COMPETENCIA EN SU ENTORNO, EL CREDITO ESTA DESTINADO PARA LA AMPLIACION DE SU VIVIENDA.  NO TIENE DEUDAS CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS SOLO EN AGROCAPITAL TIENE BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO.
texts.en:
Juan has a family that is comprised of six members: him, his wife, and their four children ages 3, 6, 8 and 13. They all live in his home in this locality. Juan has a grocery store, which has been administered by his wife for many years. Juan works heavy machinery in the community, and he has very little competition in the area. The loan is destined to help him expand his home. He doesn’t have debt with other financial entities, only with Agrocapital. He has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his home.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkelema de l’association Kotognontala sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  en majorité dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames à TDJILA chef lieu de commune dans la commune de WATENI situé dans la sous préfecture de NIENA de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. )
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui vont de l’achat – vente de céréales  à la restauration.
Dans le souci d’avoir des ressources financières complémentaires elles ont décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur premier prêt (prêt solidaire).
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 15sacs de 100kg de céréales et un important stock de condiments pour la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent  au marché de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA et de KOUGNA. Les marchandises sont vendues  au marché de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA, et de TDJILA; en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 10.000FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie investie dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkelema group from the Kotognontala association are all married and are on average 32 years old with 2 children. They live mostly in traditional polygamous families in Tdjila, the administrative centre of the Wateni commune, situated in the sub-prefecture of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses which range from the purchase and resale of cereals to food preparation. With the hope of securing supplementary financial resources, they decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their first group loan. With this loan, they intend to buy fifteen 100-kg bags of cereals and a sizeable stock of condiments for food preparation. They supply themselves at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, and Kougna. Their goods are sold at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, and Tdjila, at retail and in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. They each foresee generating an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, of which one portion will be used to meet their families' needs and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals and condiments for food preparation

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
La señora Armandina y su esposo trabajan en una maquiladora, ella es operadora y él mecánico; tienen 2 hijos de nivel escolar.
El problema que se presenta en su vivienda es que la instalación hidraulica del cuarto de baño, está muy deteriorada y como consecuencia existe una fuga y la humedad es común en la mayor parte del día, resultando desagradable y poco higienico.
Ellos solicitan su colaboración para sustituir toda la tubería y no tener más este problema, su deseo tambien es remodelar el baño, sin embargo solo empezaran y mas adelante pretenden continuar con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Armandina and her husband work in a border assembly plant, Armandina as an operator and her husband as a mechanic. They have 2 children who study, one in elementary school and the other in high school. They have a problem in their home, the pipes in the bathroom are presently extremely deteriorated and rotting which is causing the bathroom to always be damp, this without tanking into account that the shower pipe has also already rotted. They are requesting this loan because they have to change all the pipes to no longer have this problem, and they also want to fix the bathroom properly so that it can look presentable when they offer it to their guests.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix bathroom pipes.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: ISAIAS ES SOLTERO Y VIVE CON SU MADRE Y HERMANA MAYOR. ISAIAS SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PAPA POR CARGAS, TRAE DESDE CHAPACIRCA Y LA COMERCIALIZA EN LA CIUDAD, POR OTRA PARTE INGRESO A TRABAJAR EN UNA INDUSTRIA DE CERVEZA DE DONDE RECIBE UN SALARIO MENSUAL. TIENE COMPETENCIA EN SU RUBRO PERO POR LA ZONA DONDE VIVE TIENE BUENOS PROVEEDORES Y REALIZA CON BASTANTE ÉXITO LA COMERCIALIZACION DE PAPA, TRAE ESPECIALMENTE LOS FINES DE SEMANA. COMPRARA UN TOTAL DE 30 CARGAS DE PAPA DE LA ZONA DE CHAPACIRCA, Y LO COMERCIALIZARA EN EL MERCADO. ES LA TERCERA VEZ QUE ISAIAS SACA CREDITO DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION Y EN SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS TUVO EN BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO EN SUS CREDITOS.
texts.en:
Isaias is single and lives with his mother and older sister. Isaias dedicates himself to the purchase and sale of potatoes that he brings from Chapacirca and markets in the city. For additional income, he also works at a beer manufacturer where he earns a monthly salary. He is competent at his chosen trade, but in the zone where he lives there are good providers and he realizes his sales with great success. He brings them especially on weekends. He will buy a total of 30 loads of potatoes from the Chapacirca zone, that he will sell in the market. This is the third time that Isaias takes out credit from our institution and, in his previous loans, he had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.en:
Maria Leonardo is a 44-year-old woman. Her business is making and selling tortillas in her house. She sells the tortillas in the morning, afternoon, and in the evening. She also spends her time making hand-made napkins. She has seven children, two of whom are teachers and the rest are still in school. Her husband delivers construction materials and his income helps to pay for the education of their children.

Maria Leonardo needs a loan in order to buy the tortilla ingredients in bulk. This time of year she can buy things like corn and firewood at a much better price. 

Her dream is to increase her income and that her younger children can finish their education. 


***********************************************

Maria Leonardo es una mujer de 44 años de edad.  Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortilla en su casa.  Las tortillas se venden por las mañanas, al medio día  y por las tardes.  También ocupa su tiempo en la elaboración de tejidos a mano, para servilletas.  Ella tiene 7 hijos, 2 de ellos son maestros de educación, los demás están estudiando todavía.  Su esposo trabaja en la entrega de materiales de construcción y él le ayuda a pagar la educación de los hijos.
Maria Leonarda necesita el préstamo para comprar por volumen y a mejor precio los materiales para las tortillas, como lo son maíz y leña, ya que en esta época del año las puede comprar a mejor precio.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y que sus hijos pequeños terminen su educación.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: el grupo esta compuesto por tres integrantes que son: Adriana Z., ella vive en la aldea de Lajero Blanco donde  tiene su pequeño negocio de pulpería, vende a las personas de ese mismo lugar, ella desea crecer la unión familiar a  pesar  que es  madre  soltera . Alba Tomasa N. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, se levanta temprano y viene a la ciudad a vender su producto, vende baleadas, pan blanco con mantequilla, panqueques, café y avena con leche. ella compra todo lo que necesita para elaborar sus productos en la ciudad, en estos momentos ella necesita darles educación a dos nietos que viven con ella los cuales a criado desde que son bebes, ya que sus padres murieron ,vive sola con sus dos nietos.  Maria Josefa R. se dedica a la venta de golosinas como: tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de papas, tajaditas de plátano, yuca con chicharrón y refrescos naturales. vende el producto en la exportadora de melón que  esta cerca del lugar donde vive, se levanta temprano para salir a vender su producto y regresa a las dos de la tarde a su casa descansa un poco y luego a preparar las golosinas del siguiente día. es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya están casados, una de sus hijas vive cerca de su casa y ella le ayuda a la preparación del producto.
texts.en:
This group has three members. The first is Adriana Z., a single mother who lives in the village of Lajero Blanco and runs a small juice stand for the community in the hopes of increasing her family's income. The second is Alba Tomasa N., who dedicates herself to selling sweets and snacks. She gets up very early in the morning to travel to the city and sell her products, she sells tortillas, buttered bread, pancakes, coffee etc. She also buys all her supplies when she is in town. Right now, she is working so that she can provide an education for her two grandchildren, whom she has raised since they were infants. Ever since their parents' death, they have lived with her. The third member of the group is Maria Josefa R., who dedicates herself to selling snacks. She sells tacos, enchiladas, potato pastries, fried plantain, yuca with sausage, and natural juices. She gets up early in the morning to sell her products at a melon exporting business near where she lives, and returns home at two in the afternoon every day to start preparing the next day's snacks. She is a single mother and has three children who are already married. One of her daughters lives near Maria's house and helps her with food preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinks, beans, bread, butter, cheese, vegetables and meat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: ISIDORO  VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS UN NIÑO DE 4 AÑOS Y UNA NIÑA DE 2 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVEN EN LA CASA QUE SU PADRE LES HEREDO. ISIDORO SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CHATARRA, COMPRA ALUMINIO, COBRE, BRONCE. TAMBIEN COMPRA BATERIAS USADAS. LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CAHTARRA COMPRA Y VENDE POR KILO. TIENE COMPETENCIA EN SU RUBRO PERO YA QUE TODA SU FAMILIA  SE DEDICA A ESTE NEGOCIO ELLOS TIENEN BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA. SE LE HA PRESENTADO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE COMPRAR UN LOTE IMPORTANTE DE CHATARRA POR LO QUE REQUERIA EL CREDITO, EL CAPITAL QUE INVERTIRA ES DE 4050 BS.y EL SALDO RESTANTE LO UTILIZARÁ PARA USO PERSONAL. ES LA SEXTA VEZ QUE EL CLIENTE SACA CREDITO DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, EN CADA UNO DE LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO TUVO UN BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO.
texts.en:
Isidoro lives with his wife, and has a 4-year old son and 2-year old daughter. They live in the home he inherited from his parents. Isidoro dedicates himself to the purchase and sale of scrap metal, and buys aluminum, copper and bronze. He also buys used batteries. He buys and sells his scrap metals by the kilo. He is competent at his trade but, since his whole family dedicates itself to this business, they have a great deal of experience. An opportunity has presented itself for him to buy an important lot of scraps, for which he required the loan. The capital he will invest is 4050 BS. This is the sixth time that this client has taken credit from our institution, and his previous repayment history has been good.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice T. sells fish. She buys fish from fishermen, processes and preserves the fish and sells them at the market at Bantama in Elmina, Ghana. Beatrice does not have a formal education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works with the hydro-electrical service department. Beatrice has been selling fish since 1990. She is responsible for supporting her husband by paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop a plot of land, which she bought with her husband to put up their family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’avédji à adjidogomé, il a pour métier la tapisserie et  vend des mousses, il a déjà obtenu un crédit de wages et sollicite un deuxième crédit d’un montant de 200000F pour acheter des mousses et agrandir son stock. Il est marié à une dame  qui est revendeuse et ils ont deux enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Avédji district in Adjidogomé. He is an upholsterer by trade and sells foam padding. He has already been the recipient of a loan from WAGES and is requesting a second one in the amount of 200,000 francs to buy foam pads and to expand his stock. He is married to a lady who is a retailer, and they have two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foam pads

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Estelvina vende ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos desde hace seis años, que con propios esfuerzos y ahorros y ayuda de su esposo comenzó la venta de ropa, tiene 49 años de edad, y reside en anexo villa libertad del centro de salud 1 c al este 13 andenes al sur, con tres hijos de 8,10 y 22 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y los dos estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio, su esposo trabaja de maestro de obra, en los diferentes construcciones del país, trabajo que es pesado pero se gana regular y por su familia todo lo puede, doña Estelvina hace prestamos en Afodenic desde hace ocho ciclos que ha sido de beneficios para las mejoras a su negocio, con esta solicitud va invertir en comprar ropa y zapatos para aumentar su inventario y vender mas y poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. a futuro es poder hacer mas grande su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus hijas a que se preparen con sus estudio.
texts.en:
Estelvina has been selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics for six years. She started selling clothes through her own efforts, savings and the help of her husband. She is 49 years old, and lives in Villa Libertad with three children ages 8, 10, and 22. The oldest works, and the other two are studying primary at the neighborhood’s school. Her husband works as a master builder at different construction projects in the country, work that is difficult but provides steady income and he does all he can for his family. Estelvina has taken loans through Afodenic for eight cycles, and they have been of great benefit to her business. With this request, she will invest in the purchase of more clothes and shoes to increase her inventory, sell more, and meet the demand of her customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue helping her daughters to prepare themselves with their educations.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Adama Alassane

texts.fr: Agé de 26 ans Adama est un chauffeur de taxi sans femme.Avec son vehicule de transport urbain,il fait chaque jour plusieurs fois le tour de ville pour transporter des passagers.Les revenus ussis du  taxi lui  permet d'aider ses perents restés au village mais aussi de faire quelque économies pour le mariage.Il envisage avec le pret qu' il demande de renouveler le moteur du vehicule qui commence à etre fatigué avant que le vehicule ne s'arrete.
texts.en:
Adama, age 26, is a taxi driver without a wife. With his vehicle for urban transportation, he goes around town several times a day to transport passengers. The revenues from it enable him to assist his parents back in the village but also to save a little money for marriage. With this loan he is requesting, he envisions refurbishing the motor, which is starting to wear out, before the vehicle gives up.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Group 4 from the Fuente de Paz (Source of Peace) Bank of Hope is now on their 6th loan cycle. Ana R. is the coordinator of this group of five. She has 2 children ages 9 and 5 and her business is clothing sales. 
Ana sells all kinds of clothing on her business. She has found that lately some products are on higher demand than others, so she will use this new loan to purchase a quantity of products that will allow her to have merchandise in stock for a longer time. She specifically will purchase pants, shirts, polo shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes and undergarments. She will also buy personal care products like lotion and deodorant to sell. 
Ana says her biggest challenge is communicating with difficult customers. Unfortunately, not everyone is as pleasant to deal with. But she understands it´s a part of the process when you are in sales. 
Ana sees her business in the future growing even more, and established as a clothing store. She believes her business has allowed her to provide better for her family. Her long term goal is to finish building her house with her business profits. 
On behalf of these entrepreneurs, and Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: purchase merchandise on high demand and expand to different products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Juliana sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 1994. Her husband is a fisherman. Juliana uses her income to help pay the children's school fees and other family expenses. Juliana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to save towards a house she wants to put up for the children.

loans.use: Juliana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Akuvi Kékéli

texts.fr: Kékéli habite dans le quartier de bè klikamè, elle est une coiffeuse son atelier s’appelle PEPITA coiffure, elle fait la coiffure depuis 1999, elle a associé à son activité de coiffure la vente de produits de beauté et perruques, beaucoup de femme de son quartier viennent se faire belle chez elle, elle veut les satisfaire convenablement et c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à wages pour demander un crédit de 450000F pour l’achat de produits de beauté, mèches et perruques . Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants
texts.en:
Kékéli lives in the Bè-Klikamè district. She is a hairdresser, and her shop is called “PEPITA Coiffure”. She has been in this business since 1999. In addition to her work, she has included the sale of beauty products and wigs. Many women in her area come to her place to make themselves beautiful. She wants to satisfy them properly, and this is why she is contacting WAGES to ask for a loan of 450,000 francs to buy beauty products, hair extensions, and wigs. She is married and the mother of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products, weaves, etc.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Jesús is a 58-year-old woman who was born in the countryside of Guatemala but now lives in Villa Nueva, a heavily populated area outside of Guatemala City. She is a member of the “Women's Trust Bank,” which is the name of the group lending program at FAPE. 

She sells beef and firewood for cooking. Her husband helps her with her business. 

Jesús has 11 children, four of whom are still single and they also help her with the businesses. She hopes to invest more in the businesses so that it will grow. In order to do so, she needs a loan so she can increase her merchandise.


************************************************

Jesús, es una mujer de 58 años de edad, ella nació en un lugar en el interior del país, y después se traslado a vivir a la comunidad de Villa Nueva, que es donde actualmente vive. Ella es integrante de un Banco de Mujeres de Confianza, que es el nombre del programa de préstamos grupal de FAPE.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de res, y también vende leña para cocinar,  Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio.

Jesús tiene 11 hijos, y ahora solo 4 están solteros, y ellos le ayudan en sus negocios también.  Su deseo es invertir en sus negocios y que crezcan.  Por eso necesita un préstamo para tener más mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina. Agnes has received junior high school education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Agnes has been selling fish since 1994. She is responsible for helping to pay the children's school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into her business and expand her trade in processed fish.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Lide Del Carmen

texts.es: La sra Lide tiene 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la ciudad de Managua, con cinco hijos mayores de edad, trabajan y me ayudan,   su esposo se desempeña en carpintería, el negocio de la doña Lide es la venta de cosmético, ropa y zapatos, desde hace siete años comenzó con ayudad de su esposo, sus planes es poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofertar sus productos variados, con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar productos de la Avon , ropa de niño y adultos, unos son encargos que entrega al crédito  para la quincena, y otros para su inventario, espera obtener mejores ingresos y seguir creciendo en las ventas.
texts.en:
Lide is 46 years old and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has five grown children who work and help her out. Her husband is a carpenter. Lide’s business is the sale of cosmetics, clothes and shoes. She started seven years ago with her husband’s help. Her plan is to be able to have a store where she could offer her varied products. The request of this loan is to buy Avon products, children and adult clothing, for some orders that she gives on credit, and for her inventory. She hopes to generate better income and continue growing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and Avon products.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames, dans le village de TDJILA chef lieu de commune dans la commune de WATENI situé dans la sous préfecture de NIENA de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat – vente de céréales, de soumbala, des savons, d’arachide, des condiments et la restauration.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt (prêt solidaire) et comptent  l’utiliser pour acheter, 5 sacs de 100kg de céréales, 4 paquets de savons, 100 kilogrammes de grains de Néré pour faire le soumbala, 5 sacs d’arachides  et des condiments.
Elle s’approvisionnent  aux marchés de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA et de TDJILA  auprès de grossistes et producteurs  et revendent au marché de TDJILA; en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 8.780FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie investie dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Dembagnouma group are all married and on average 33 years old with 5 children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the village of Tdjila, the administrative centre of the town of Wateni, situated in the sub-prefecture of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses which include among others the preparation of food and the purchase, preparation, and re-sale of cereals, soumbala (a West African condiment made from fermented néré seeds), soaps, peanuts, and condiments. They are seeking their first group loan, which they intend to use to buy five 100-kg bags of cereals, 4 packs of soap, 100 kilograms of néré seeds to make soumbala, 5 bags of peanuts, and other condiments. They supply themselves at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, and Tdjila, from wholesalers and producers, and sell their goods at the market in Tdjila at retail and in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. They each foresee generating an average monthly profit of 8,780 FCFA, of which one portion will be used to meet their families' needs and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Elina

texts.fr: Elina habite le quartier de gbadagbo, elle fait le commerce de produits génériques  et ce depuis  2001, elle voudrait agrandir son stock c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite pour sa deuxième fois à wages un crédit de 300000F, elle est mariée à un brodeur  et a 02 enfants
texts.en:
Elina lives in the Gbadagbo district. She has been doing commerce in generic pharmaceutical products since 2001. She would like to expand her inventory, and so she is requesting for a second time a loan from WAGES in the amount of 300,000 francs. She is married to an embroiderer and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica G. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, in Elmina. Veronica has received junior high school education. She is single and has no children. Veronica has been selling fish since 1995. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into her business to expand her trade in processed fish.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana G. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Diana sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, in Elmina. She has been doing this business since February of this year. Diana uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Diana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana plans to reinvest and expand her trade in processed fish.

loans.use: Diana will use the loan to purchase increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mawuena habite le quartier d’avédji, elle a pour activité la vente de produits pharmaceutiques, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante, elle le fait depuis 2006, elle veut agrandir son stock avec l’achat de produits pharmaceutiques, elle demande donc à wages un produit de 500000f. Elle est veuve avec un enfant, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mawuena lives in the Avédji district. Her work involves selling pharmaceutical products. She goes door-to-door in the course of her work, which she has been doing since 2006. She wants to expand her inventory by buying pharmaceuticals. And so she’s asking WAGES for a loan of 500,000 francs. Mawuena is a widow with a child. With the income from this business, she provides for her child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Juana Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes inició el negocio cuando dejo de trabajar en una tienda comercial donde era empleada y se quedo sin ningún ingreso que le permitiera solventar sus necesidades y las de su madre la cual depende de ella. Comenzó el negocio  en Febrero de 1995 cuando dejo de trabajar como empleada, inicio con una papelería que acondiciono en su casa aprovechando que vive en una avenida muy transitada; además vendía productos para el hogar y de belleza de reconocidas marcas, pero en Febrero de 1995 una tía la convenció que vendiera joyería de oro ya que se acercaba el día de San Valentín y ella viajaba a la ciudad de Guadalajara a comprar, siguió su consejo y así empezó con la joyería, pero después salio la moda de los collares y pulseras de fantasía y plata, y empezó a comprar revistas para aprender a hacerlas y le gustó mucho, hasta la fecha se dedico a esto y le va muy bien. 

Como le ha ido muy bien con la bisutería ya volví a meter artículos de papelería, así como  regalos y novedades para complementar por lo cual de esta manera puede tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y no depender solo de la venta de  la bisutería.


Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar materia prima para elaborar bolsas, pulseras, collares, añillos, etc., y tener un extenso surtido para este 14 de febrero que se acerca y que la gente aprovecha para regalar a sus amistades.
texts.en:
Lourdes began her business in February 1995, when she stopped working at her earlier job in a store and was left without an income. She had no way to provide for herself and for her mother, who is dependent on her. At first, she ran a stationer's out of her house, taking advantage of the fact that her street is a very busy one; then she expanded the range of items she sold to include household products and cosmetics. After a while, an aunt of hers convinced her to start selling gold jewelery in the run up to Valentine's day. Lourdes took her advice and her jewelery business took off. Necklaces and bracelets came into fashion, and she sold many kinds. She also began to read up on how to make jewelery, and really enjoys the process. Now she makes many pieces herself. Since her jewelery business has grown, she has also added other products to her stock. Now, to complement the jewelery, she offers other kinds of gifts and novelty items. In this way, she can have various streams of income and won't be completely dependent on jewelery sales. Lourdes needs a loan of $10,000 pesos, which she will repay in 12 installments, so that she can buy supplies she needs to make bags, bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc. She wants to have lots to offer this Valentine's day and she wants to be able to help people give their friends gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supplies for jewelery making

loans.name: Wal Fatkhou Group

texts.fr: le groupement wal fatkhou est une association regroupant quatre femmes (04) oeuvrant pour l'ameillioration des conditions de vie de la femme.Il est dirigé par la nommée Diame N.  qui vend des tissus de meme que marietou .les deux autres sont dans le commerce de repas et la quincaillerie.Avec les revenus tires de leurs activités elles parcipement aux charges de lurs foyers respectifs mais parviennent à affirmer leur autonomie financiere .Pour renforcer respectivement leur activité elle sollicite un pret au pres de linstitution de microfinance.
texts.en:
The group Wal Fatkhou is an association of four women working to improve living conditions for women. They are directed by the renowned Diame N., who sells cloth, just like Marietou does. Two others do commerce in hardware and in selling meals. With the revenues derived from their businesses, the women help cover the expenses in their respective households but also manage to maintain their financial autonomy. To bolster their respective businesses, they are requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kossivi Eric

texts.fr:
A. éric habite le quartier  de soviépé et à une boutique de prêt-à-porter qu’il  appelle  
‘’Prêt-à-porter ERIC’’, il a commencé ce commerce en 2006 et cela lui réussit bien, les jeunes de l’homme aime beaucoup le look c’est pour celà qu’il a entamé ce commerce, il veut agrandir son stock c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de 500000F pour s’acheter des vêtements féminin et masculin.il est marié et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Eric A. lives in the Soviépé district and has a shop selling ready-to-wear clothing. “Prêt-à-porter ERIC” is the name of his shop, a business he started in 2006 that has been successful for him. Young men like to be in style a lot. That’s why he started in this commerce. He wants to expand his inventory, so he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy clothing for women and men. Eric is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for men and women

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa reside en  villa reconciliación, tiene 46 años de edad, con una pequeña pulpería y venta de golosinas de tres años de administrarla que inicio con fondo que su esposo dio, tiene 46 años de edad, con cuatro hijos que están independientes, su esposo se desempeña como cadete de taxi. Con la solicitud va invertir en la compra de granos básicos y productos de higiene personal, para llenar su inventario y ofertar a sus clientes, sus planes es hacer su venta mas amplias para captar mas clientes y obtener mejores utilidades en el ámbito del negocio, como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia R. O. is 46 years old and resides in Villa Reconciliación. Three years ago she started a small store with funds given to her by her husband, who is also 46 years old. They have four grown children and her husband is a taxi cadet (driver). With the funds requested, she will invest in the purchase of basic grains and personal hygiene products to the increase inventory offered to customers. Her plan is to increase sales and broaden her customer base, thus improving her business and as well as her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes inicio el negocio porqué dejo de trabajar como empleada en una empresa y quería dedicarse a una actividad que le permitiera estar mas al cuidado de sus padres y poder brindarles una mejor atención ya que son personas mayores y están a su  cargo, fue por eso que se decidió a poner su negocio de papelería. Comenzó en Febrero de 2002 en la cochera de su casa pero solo duro 3 años y lo cerro porque entro a trabajar como empleada a una empresa y no lo podía atender. Posteriormente lo reinicio en Febrero de 2002 y desde entonces se ha dedicado por completo al negocio y a cuidar de sus padres. Acaba de abrir otra papelería en otra colonia de la ciudad donde le ayuda a su hermana y una vecina,  en su papelería acaba de comprar tres computadoras para tener un tipo  Caber-café y adquirí también otra copiadora por lo que siente que ha ido progresando poco a poco.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y le  servirá mucho para capitalizarse y poder comprar papelería ya que con la compra de las computadoras se quedo  con poco dinero para invertir en mercancía.
texts.en:
Lourdes set up her stationary store because she had left her previous job working for a company, and wanted to dedicate herself to an activity that would allow her to care for her parents, who are quite dependent on her in their old age. Although she ran the store off and on for a while, it has been her only business since February 2002. Since then, she has dedicated herself full time to the store and to her parents. In fact, not only has Lourdes opened a second store in another neighbourhood, with her sister and neighbour helping her run it, she has also bought a photocopier and three computers to help turn the first store into a cyber cafe as well as a stationer's. Little by little, her business is growing. Lourdes needs a loan of $12,000 pesos, which she will pay back in 10 installments, so that she can buy stationary to sell. She is short on capital at the moment. Because of the money she spent on the computers, she does not have enough left over for merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Don Enrique hombre trabajador desde joven se ha dedicado a diferentes labores para ganar el pan de cada día, hoy en día trabaja en una casa  de jardinero lleva diez años y se ha ganado la confianza de sus patrones. Tiene 56 años de edad,  reside en el barrio German Pomares en la capital de Managua, su esposa trabaja en un bar del colegio y le tiene un hijo de 21 años que esta en la universidad. Esta es su segunda solicitud que quiere invertir en repellar las paredes y comprar portón de hierro, para el estos prestamos en Afodenic han sido de muchos beneficios y ha logrado partes de sus metas, con el primer crédito hizo un muro de su casa para estar mas seguro de la delincuencia, ahora espera terminar el trabajo anterior y da gracias a Dios y a la institución. Sus planes a futuro es apoyar a su hijo a que culmine su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Enrique is a hardworking man who has worked various jobs since his youth to earn his daily bread. He has been working as a private gardener for 10 years and has won the confidence of his employers. He is 56 years old and lives in the neighborhood of German Pomares in the capital city of Managua. His wife works in a college bar, and they have a 21-year-old son attending university. This is his second loan, and he wishes to invest in plastering his walls and buying an iron gate. With these loans from Afodenic, he has benefited a great deal and has achieved some of his goals. His first loan was used to build a wall around his house to protect it from vandalism, and now he hopes to finish the job with the help of God and the institution. His plan for the future is to help his son complete his college education.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to plaster walls and purchase iron gate

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  habite le quartier d’avédji, il  a  pour activité la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, il tient une boutique appelée « ETS moustapha », il fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Il souhaite se réapprovisionner et demande un crédit de 300000f à wages.il  est marié sans enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Avédji district. His work involves selling grocery items. He has a shop called «ETS Moustapha» and has been in this business since 2006. He acquires supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. He would like to resupply himself and is asking WAGES for a loan of 300,000 francs. He is married and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Tchéfiou

texts.fr: O.  habite le quartier d’adidogomé et a pour activité la vente des articles de mercerie, il fait ce commerce depuis 2001 et a une boutique à la devanture de son domicile, il  a déjà obtenu un crédit qu’il a remboursé, il souhaite agrandir son stock et associer la vente de ciment, pour cela il sollicite un deuxième crédit d’un montant de 300000F à wages.il est marié, sa femme est un couturière  et ils ont ensemble 01 enfants.
texts.en:
O. lives in the Adidogomé district. His work involves selling tailoring supplies. He has been in this business since 2001 and has a shop in the front of his home. He’s already been the recipient of a loan, which he repaid. He would like to expand his stock and to include the sale of cement. To do so, he is requesting a second loan from WAGES in the amount of 300,000 francs. He is married, and his wife is a dressmaker. Together they have one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Raïnatou

texts.fr: A.    habite le quartier d’adidogomé, où elle exerce le commerce de pagnes et de bijoux de façon ambulante, ce commerce marche bien pour elle et la demande est très elevée, pour y faire face, elle sollicite un crédit de 300000F pour agrandir son stock avec l’achat de pagnes et bijoux, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1997 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé . Elle mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A. lives in the Adidogomé district, where she goes door-to-door selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and jewelry. Her commerce is doing very well, and demand is quite high. To respond to this, she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to expand her inventory by buying some pagnes and jewelry gotten from the grand marketplace of Lomé. She has been in this business since 1997. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Ayaba Djigbondi

texts.fr: Cette dame fait un peu de commerce général, elle vend des boissons, des produits de beauté et des produits d’alimentation. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez wages, elle demande un second crédit de wages d’un montant de 500000F pour acheter des produits de beauté, des boissons et des produits d’alimentation. Elle est célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Elle travaille dur pour pouvoir bien s’occuper  de sa famille
texts.en:
This is a lady who works in general commerce a little. She sells beverages, beauty products, and grocery items. She has been in this business since 2002 and has already been the recipient of a WAGES loan. She is asking for a second loan from WAGES in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy beauty products, beverages, and groceries. She is unmarried and a mother with a child. She works hard to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and more

loans.name: Bébégnon

texts.fr: V. bébégnon est un coiffeur dans le quartier de tokoin cassanblanca à lomé, il voudrait associé à son commerce la vente des articles de fripperie et ouvrir un autre atelier, pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 500000f, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages. il est célibataire sans enfants avec son surplus de revenu, il arrive à aider les membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bébégnon V. is a barber in the Tokoin Cassanblanca district in Lomé. He would like to include with his business the sale of used clothing, sheets, towels, and the like. He would also like to open another shop. To do so, he’s requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. He has never been the recipient of a loan from WAGES. He is unmarried and has no children. With his extra income, he manages to help his family members.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For opening another shop and for used clothing

loans.name: Ami Brigitte

texts.fr: Amavi brigitte habite le quartier de gblinkomégnon et a pour activité le commerce de plastiques te divers, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1993 et de façon ambulante, elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 450000f qu’elle a déjà remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit de 500000f afin de pouvoir augmenter son stock, elle est veuve et a trois enfants, elle travaille dur pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amavi Brigitte lives in the Gblinkomégnon district. Her work involves commerce in plastics and various goods. She goes door-to-door and has been in this business since 1993. She has already been the recipient of a loan of 450,000 francs, which she has already repaid. She’s requesting a second loan of 500,000 francs in order to increase her inventory. She is a widow with three children who works hard to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastics and various goods

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Rosemary M. from Mwanza; she is single with one child, 10 years old. Rosemary has been running a shop business since 2006. Client’s business is to sell different clothes such as shirts, T-shirts, and hand bags for women. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rosemary currently earns about 300USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more shirts, hand bags and pouches. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts; hand bags and pouches

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina sells bed sheets, towels, and blankets at the central market. She has been in this business for 17 years. These types of goods are in high demand. Irina is divorced and both of her children are gown up. Her daughter is married and lives separately. Irina lives with her son. 

This business is the only source of income for Irina. Irina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase 50 bed sheet sets. She knows that having good variety of product is one of the main keys in making good sales.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bed sheet sets

loans.name: Berta Georgina

texts.es:
la señora Berta Georgina N. tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera, tiene tres hijos  
a los cuales les ha dado el estudio a traves de su trabajo, el cual lo tiene en la escuela
agricola y tambien tiene el negocio de venta de ropa , zapatos y electrodomesticos. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 04 años y esta ubicado en el barrio el calvario de esta ciudad de nacaome. a traves de su labor realiza mercadeo en distintos barrios de esta ciudad y ha obtenido una buena clientela. los productos que ella vende son enviados de norte america ya que tiene familiares alla que le realizan las compras y se los envian a traves de barco a nuestro pais, esto es para que la sra. N. los los pueda vender y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Berta Georgina N. is 55 years old, single, and has three children. She was able to give her children an education with the income she earned working at the Agricultural College and running her own business selling clothes, shoes and household appliances. She has run this business for four years, and it is located in a neighbourhood known as El Calvario in Nacaome City. Her clients, however, come from various neighbourhoods in the city and over the years she has built up a faithful client base. The products she sells are imported from North America, where she has relatives who make purchases for her and send them by sea. This way, Mrs N. gets her products more slowly, but she is able to make a better profit when she sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes and household appliances

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Mr. V., a young man of 25 years of age. He is married and he has two children.  Each day he makes chipas (a traditional yucca-based snack) at his home and then drives throughout the city selling them from his vehicle.  He also receives orders in advance for special events at local schools, and occasionally he fills orders from Ciudad del Este. 

Mr. V. says that his business involves lots of sacrifice as he must work many hours each day in order to produce and sell his product.  Nevertheless, he says that his primary goal is to use his business to support his family and to be able to pay for basic necessities.  

With a loan from Fundación Paraguaya, Mr. V. will be able to buy large quantities of ingredients, like starch, corn, and cheese.  These large purchases will allow him to cope with the rise in prices that usually occurs during the weeks around Holy Week.

loans.use: For the purchase materials used to make chipas, such as cheese, corn, oil, and egg, etc.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Mr. I. is 53 years old and is married with two children.  His older son, who is 25 years old, helps him with his business, Despensa Don Lino.  He has had this small market and meat shop for more than 22 years.  Mr. I. says that like all businesses, his sales have their high and low points, and that these days the country’s overall situation is affecting the meat business.  As beef, milk, and wheat products go up in price, there is a loss of sales in markets like the one owned by Mr. I..  

Mr. I. says that one of his hopes is for an improvement in the country’s quality of life, as the current lack of opportunities for young people causes them to look for work in other countries, something that has consequences on many families.  

He says that his business allowed him to build his own house, support his family, and help his son go to university.  With a loan from Fundación Paraguaya, he plans to buy products and stock his store with the staples that he sells daily, such as milk, beef, beer, sodas, wine, and noodles, among others.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as beef, chicken, fruit, vegetables, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. D. is 58 years old, married, and has two children.  For the last 26 years she has owned and operated a small, well-stocked store, that is located in the Loma neighborhood of Caacupé.  This neighborhood is full of people and most of the entrepreneurs make and sell chipas.  They are the people who generate daily work and thus move the economy of the area.  Mrs. D. benefits from these workers, because they spend their earnings at the area’s small stores, where they buy the products that they need each day.  

Mrs. D. says that she is worried about the emigration of young people to other countries in search of work.  She hopes that the situation will improve with the creation of more sources of work, especially for the people of the mountain region because there are many young, hard-working people there.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, meat, and beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Barrio Kennedy Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 17 women who work in the Kennedy neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  It is currently in its 10th cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the women work selling goods in small stores and kiosks, selling cold drinks, selling clothing, making chipas, and cutting hair.  The 17 women are maintaining a line of credit with an average of 923,000 Guaranís ($185.00) per member of the group.  

With the loans they receive from Fundación Paraguaya, the women invest in the purchase of the products they need to keep their businesses well-stocked: ingredients for chipas, sugar, cookies, beef, oil, and men’s and women’s clothing. 

These days the group is also attending activities on the weekends, such as food fairs and raffles, with the goal of capitalizing its savings so that the savings can support members at times when they cannot make good on their payments for some reason.  

The representative of the group and the president thank and acknowledge all the supporters of Fundación Paraguaya for the support and training that they provide.

loans.use: Supplies for the various businesses, such as milk and sugar, and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendoras Porá Rekavo Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 women who work in the Kennedy neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  The group is in the 10th cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the women work at selling goods in small stores, selling chipas, and selling and tailoring clothing.  The 16 women are maintaining a line of credit that averages 1,025,000 Guaranís ($205.00) per member. 

With the loans they receive from Fundación Paraguaya they invest in the purchase of products for their businesses, such as ingredients for chipas, men’s and women’s clothing, and food items such as sugar, cookies, meet, oil, and milk. 

The group members express their thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have given in providing the women with capital.  They also feel very pleased to be part of the Women’s Entrepreneurs program as the beneficiaries are their own businesses. The women invested their previous capital loans that they received into their businesses and with their good management the results have been excellent.  These days, their small businesses are in a stage of growth.

loans.use: Supplies for the various businesses, such as cheese, rice, and noodles, and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: VICTORIA A.  D. M.  VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA COMUNIDAD D. VILLA ARRIENDO PROVINCIA  INGAVI, DURANTE 28 AÑOS. LA SEÑORA VICTORIA A. D. M., TIENE NEGOCIO PROPIO D. COMPRA Y VENTA PAPA, CHUÑO Y TUNTA, COMERCIALIZA AL POR MAYOR EN LAS FERIAS D. LA CIUDAD Y PROVINCIA, CUENTA CON 13 AÑOS D. EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, SU ESPOSO ES PROFESOR TRABAJA EN EL COLEGIO CHORITOTORA. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, VICTORIA TIENE UN BUEN TRATO A SUS CLIENTES Y RESPONSABILIDAD Y SU PUESTO D. VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PLENA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. VICTORIA DESTINARÁ EL CREDITO  PARA LA COMPRA D. MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL CENTRAL D. RIESGOS NI EL BURO D. INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Victoria A. D. M. has lived with her family in the community of Villa Arriendo in Ingavi province for 28 years. Victoria has her own business, selling potatoes and dried potatoes, which she sells in bulk at citywiD. and provincial markets. She has 13 years of experience working in this field. Her husband is a teacher at the Choritotora school. There exists a great deal of competition in the market, but Victoria has strong customer relations, responsibility, and a stall in the main plaza. She will use the loan to purchase bulk merchandise. She has no negative history with the Risk Center or Bureau of Infocred.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk merchandise

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona G. is 50 years old and she is married with three children.  Her business, which she started more than 25 years ago, is a small store that she runs from her home and it is very well known in her neighborhood.  And now, with the help of a loan, she will be able to keep her business very well stocked.  She also plans to increase the size of her store because the small amount of space she has available now is not able to hold the merchandise she has in stock.

Mrs. G. said she was a fighter through the sacrifices involved in her business because she works seven days a week and does not have a weekend.  She begins work at the store at 5:00 am but she feels happy to run her own business and with it she is able to cover her family’s expenses and provide a good education for her children. 

Her main customers are the salaried workers in the neighborhood as well as local salesmen and factory workers, to whom she provides breakfast and snacks.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as beef, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sugar, milk, and beverages of all types.

loans.name: Comité De Mujeres Emprendedoras De Caacupé Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 16 women who work in the Seminarioa neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  The group is currently in the 10th cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the women work in sales—running small stores, selling chipas, selling clothing, and selling paper, among other activities.  

The women are maintaining a line of credit that averages 1,243,000 Guaranís ($249.00) per member.  With the loans they have received from Fundación Paraguaya, they have invested in the purchase of products for the production of chipas, items to keep their stores stocked, men’s and women’s clothing, and food items such as sugar, cookies, beef, and oil.  

The president of the group, Mrs. Rogelia G., gave her thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the support and confidence she has received from them.  She promised on behalf of the group to uphold the agreement they entered to make payments on time, as they have been doing since their first cycle in the program.

loans.use: The purchase of supplies for the various businesses, such as sodas, milk, cookies, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, desde hace seis años la señora Silvia J. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son elaboradas por ella misma  todos los días con el propósito de comercializarlas en su sector a sus clientes que le visitan.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día la razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y así continuar con el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, Silvia J. has worked for the past six years making and selling tortillas. She makes these tortillas daily, in order to sell them to the clients who visit her booth. She has joined with Kiva partner Ceprodel in order to secure a loan which will allow her to buy the ingredients necessary to continue making tortillas, and in this way continue to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Bárbara

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Barbara M. se dedica a su actividad de venta de granos básicos los cuales son comercializados en su local vendiendo todo tipo de granos tales como arroz, maíz, frijoles, entre otros.

Hoy en día ella requiere mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ofertando mayores cantidades de granos básicos y es por esta razón que muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de dichos granos y así continuar en su comercialización diaria. Es importante destacar que con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, Barbara Martinez works selling staple grains. Her business sells all kinds of grains, such as rice, corn, and beans, among others. She now needs to improve the caliber of her business by offering greater quantities of goods, and for this reason she has applied for a loan through Kiva partner Ceprodel. She will use the money to purchase said grains and thus continue her day to day sales. It is important to point out that this loan will be extremely beneficial to her and allow her to keep her buisiness going.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple grains

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Rey de Reyes",  están representados por la señora Pura quien presenta un como nexo consanguíneo con su hermano el señor Cristian al igual que la señora Dunia y Elizabeth pero ambos cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias de este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida por las noches y son promotoras de cosméticos, venta de refrescos, pan, otros se dedican a actividades como la confección de prendas de vestir, serigrafía .como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda pero los socios saben como salir adelante por sus propios medios. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para ampliar los lugares de atención de sus negocios así como para la compra de insumos y materiales.  Las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que se encuentran en su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad y honestidad en su trabajo y en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The partners of the "Rey de Reyes" communal bank are represented by Pura, who serves as a familial nexus between her brother Cristian as well as partners Dunia and Elizabeth. Each of them has a totally independent income from various activities--some sell food in the evenings, promote cosmetics and sell soft drinks and bread; others make clothing and silkscreen. As in all commercial pursuits, there is competition and demand, but these partners know how to get ahead on their own. This loan will help them diversify their products, expand their sales locations and purchase supplies and materials. The partners have experience in solidarity groups and are now in their second cycle, demonstrating aptitude and honesty in their work and in the fulfillment of their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Gregoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria L. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de pulpería atendido en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Desde hace 8 años inició su negocio con pocos recursos y actualmente lo ha logrado suplir de productos los cuales son ofertados en su localidad.

Ella vende todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos del hogar y es opr este motivo que ella hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos. Una vez mas espera en Ceprodel confiando que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria L. is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to her convenience store in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. With very few resources she began her business 8 years ago, and has now managed to provide the products for sale in her shop. She sells a wide variety of things, from food to household products. She uses the loans provided by Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase these products. Once again, she is putting her hope in Ceprodel, trusting that her loan will be granted and she will thus be able to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products for general store

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Fifty years old and married, Mr. Ruben M. has three children who help him run his small store, Despensa Los 3 Hermanos, which he has operated for over 17 years. He says it was very difficult when he began his business selling drinks and ice cream from a small kiosk, but thanks to the assistance of his family and the constant support of his wife, he was able to develop the business. Much has been accomplished now that his enterprise is growing and his main associates are his sons, who he charges with tending to the store and buying provisions.

One of Mr. M.’s short-term objectives is to finish his home; at the moment it requires some paint and floor work. Of course, another objective is to continue supporting his sons through their studies so they will have the opportunity to achieve a more formal career.

Mr. M. says that thanks to his business he has been able to build his own home, support his family and help his sons. The loans from Fundación Paraguaya have allowed him to keep his business well-stocked with necessary items such as sugar, yerba, beef, milk, rice, and drinks.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the store such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, meat, beverages, and vegetables.

loans.name: Paz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Paz Vallejos es una dama muy esforzada en su negocio el cual se dedica a  atender su pulpería vendiendo todo tipo de productos como lo son comestibles y también productos personales y calzados en menores cantidades. Esta pulpería se encuentra muy surtida gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en su negocio.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos y por esta razón ha acudido a la institución esperando ser beneficiado con dicho crédito para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Paz Vallejos is a very hardworking woman who dedicates herself to her convenience store, in which she sells a wide variety of products: food, personal products, and shoes in small quantities. This convenience store is very well stocked thanks to her many efforts to support her business. It is important to mention that the reason Paz has now approached Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan is that she wishes to buy more of these products for her store. She is hoping that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for store

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Carmen",  representadas por la señora Nelly  quien presenta  nexo consanguíneo con la señora Maria Elvira quien es su hermana, cave mencionar que ambas tienen ingresos totalmente independientes una de la otra. gran parte de las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, algunas son promotoras de cosméticos y ala venta de frutas otros se dedican a la reparación de computadoras y a la elaboración de refrigerios y comida .como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda, pero los socios (as9 saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia en el mercado y su gran calida humana. este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para ampliar sus negocios de venta de comida, también a la compra de materiales e insumos para incrementar sus ingresos y dotar a sus familias de una mejor calidad de vida. los socios (as) van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y honestidad por lo que la fundación les brinda la oportunidad de un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "El Carmen" is represented by Nelly, who is related to the sister of one of the other members, Maria Elvira. It is important to point out that each sister works independently and has her own income. The members of the group have their own business that specialize in such things as the sale of foods, cosmetics and fruit, in the repair of computers, and in the preparation of snack foods and meals. The members are aware that their businesses face competition but they also know how to work hard and get ahead, thanks to their experience and their good character.
