Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Tp purchase  spare parts  to repair his microbus

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana D. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Christiana sells cosmetics and groceries at Broyinbima near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband operates a sawmill. Christiana uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometime the children's school fees. Christiana will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics and groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and groceries to sell

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub Q. is 43-year-old man trader who sells home products such as furniture, clocks, kettles, and other items. He started his business more than 10 years ago. Yagub is married and has one child. His profession is cook, and in the second part of the day he is working in the local restaurant. It is not very easy to combine two jobs, but Yagub does everything to keep his family in a good level of life. Yagub applied for $1200 to purchase more goods for his store and will dedicate his time only to sales.

loans.use: Purchase home products as furniture, clocks, kettles, and other items.

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
Nortoji B. has an established business selling children's clothing in her store. She started her business about 25 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from Istaravshan, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Moreover, she is planning on bringing goods in from China. Nortoji is married, and she has two adult children. She is requesting a loan of $ 600 USD in order to purchase more clothing. With additional clothing, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase  new children's  clothing for sale

loans.name: Alimotu

texts.en:
Alimotu is 37 years old. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Alimotu sells clothing materials. She carries her goods with a tray on her head as she sells them from street to street within her community. She has no shop in which to display her goods. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of N100,000 so she can rent a shop. She would also like to purchase more clothing materials to sell.

She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To rent a shop and purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon has a minivan and provides transportation services. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. He has been in this business for 5 years. Initially he rented the car, but after saving his money, he bought his own minivan with the support of his father. The business is stable and generates the main  income for Abdumanon’s family. Currently his minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of $ 500 USD. Abdumanon thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts  to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Modinot

texts.en:
Modinot designs lovely clothes for her customers. The demands for her tailoring skills are high in her community. She therefore hopes for a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase one sewing machine. This will help her meet the demands of her customers.

She is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine

loans.name: Mirta

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirta R. is married and she has four children. Her business is located in the Abasto Municipal Market, a highly commercial district, where she rents a small space. She started her business with an initial investment of 1,000,000 Guaranis, or approximately US$ 180. She began by selling clothing door-to-door and as time passed, her business grew and she obtained a large number of customers, and eventually was able to begin renting her own space.

Mrs. R. will use her loan to purchase new merchandise for the spring/summer season, which has just begun. She needs to replenish her stock in order to satisfy all of her customers, who have already placed their orders for the season.

One of Mrs. R.’ aspirations is to open her own store. By refurbishing her home she would be able to grow her business as she would be able to add the appropriate furniture and create a more comfortable environment for her customers.

loans.use: purchase of clothing for the spring and summer season

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is 61 years old. She is married with eight children. She also has 3 grandchildren.

Cecilia sells grocery provisions both wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She now needs a loan of N140,000 so she can purchase more provisions to sell.

She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is a client of LAPO.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia S. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Efia sells saucepans at the Elmina New Market, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a painter. Efia uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometime pays the children's school fees. Efia will use the loan to increase her stock of saucepans and cooking pots to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia plans to save towards a house she wants to build for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of saucepans and cooking pots

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: This is Mihail M.. He has lived in Cantemir district for more than 15 years; here he spent his childhood among his friends and family, namely his father who taught him many things about agriculture. His main activity and future plan is vegetables and  growing seeds. He wants to start his business so he decided to request a loan from MicroInvest to increase his working capital after he inherited a large lot of land from his parents. Mihail has a good enough credit history at Microinvest, and we have every confidence in this client.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Janet E.

texts.en: Janet E. A. sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market. Janet E. has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman. Janet E. has been selling used clothing since 2000. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a plot of land for building the family house; then she can stop paying rent and also gain a comfortable shelter for her family.

loans.use: To increase the stock of used clothing

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio tiene 40 años de edad, está casado con la señora María Taboada y no tienen hijos.
Antonio emigró de la ciudad de Caaguazú a la ciudad de Itá en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven vendiendo carbón a negocios y particulares, con el tiempo fueron aumentando sus clientes y por ende sus ingresos familiares. Decidió montar una despensa en su domicilio y dejarla a cargo de su esposa, el negocio dió excelentes resultados. 

Hoy dia surte a sus vecinos y antiguos clientes de carne, azúcar, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad además de carbón, el mismo solicita el préstamo para la compra de dichas mercaderías.
texts.en:
Antonio is 40 years old, married to María Taboada, and they have no children. Antonio emigrated from the city of Caaguazú to Itá searching for a better quality of life. He started working at a very young age selling coal to businesses and individuals. In time, they increased their customer base and, as a result, the family’s income. He decided to open a store in his home and leave his wife in charge of tending to the business, which has produced excellent results. Currently, he supplies his neighbors and established customers with meats, sugar, beverages, and other daily use goods in addition to coal. He himself is requesting a loan to purchase said merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Generally, to purchase meats, beverages and coal.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market. Ama has received no formal education. She is a single parent and has four dependents. Ama has been selling used clothing since 2003. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increased demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward a plot of land for the building of the family house so that she can stop paying rent and provide a comfortable shelter for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothing

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, who is married and has a grown child, started working as a market vendor five years ago and today runs her own business selling food items in the “Covered” city market in Belaya Tserkov. Presently, Lina has about 15,000 Grivnas of working capital and her monthly profit amounts to 4,700 Grivnas. 

Purchasing prices rose after the economic crisis reached the Ukraine, so Lina needed loans to maintain her inventory. She has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity, having repaid every loan received from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. This time Lina is seeking to borrow 5,000 Grivnas to purchase dried fruit wholesale.  An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married and has a son. She works hard to be able to provide for her family and pay all the bills, especially in this time of financial crisis in Ukraine. Olena runs a small vending business selling clothing items and footwear in the central market in Belaya Tserkov. She has been in the trade for over 2 and half years. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnas invested in inventory. Her net profit exceeds 2,200 Grivnas.

Olena is hoping to use the loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional better quality merchandise at wholesale price which would help her increase proceeds from sales. Olena could double her inventory since she had got her first loan. Moreover, profit generated would help her continue saving for her own housing which has been Olena’s dream for many years.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en:
Chinyere O. sells note books and stationary supplies. She sells her goods from street to street within her community. She now hopes to expand her business. 

She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more note books and stationary materials to sell. 

Chinyere is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more note books and stationary material to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. makes a living selling foodstuffs and soup ingredients. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is now requesting a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell.

Grace is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 53 años, vive en Itá y está casada  con el señor Anastacio D.  51 años D. edad. Tienen 2 hijos, Cinthia D. 19 años quien trabaja en un supermercado  y Osmar D. 18 años quien este año cursará el primer año  en la facultad. 

Clara posee un copetín hace más D. 13 años,  y empezó a trabajar en el después D. que su marido perdió el trabajo que tenía ya que a causa D. ello los problemas económicos aumentaron.

Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que tiene que levantarse a la madrugada a preparar la comida que se encargan D. vender por las calles su hijo menor y su esposo.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela bastante formada y afirma que gracias a los ingresos que genera su pequeño negocio,  ha logrado criar a sus 2 hijos quienes hoy se han convertido en personas D. bien.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. ingredientes porque el capital D. trabajo que posee no le permite realizar más variedades D. comidas para satisfacer el gusto D. todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old, lives in Itá, and is married to Anastacio who is 51 years old. They have two children, Cinthia who is 19 years old and works in a supermarket, and Osmar, who is 18 years old and starting his first year of college. Clara has owned a café for more than 13 years, having started to work after her husband lost his job, and event that created financial problems for them. She comments that the work requires a great deal of sacrifice, given that she has to rise at dawn to prepare food that her husband and son then sell throughout the streets. These days, she has a well-established customer base and affirms that, thanks to her small business, she has been able to raise two children who have become good people. She requests the loan to purchase ingredients, as the working capital she has doesn’t permit her to make a wiD. enough variety of foods to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats, flour, bread, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Hantea

texts.en: This is Hantea S. and she is 46 years old and she lives in Cantemir district, Constangalia village. Her main activity is to grow grapes for vine production so she applied for a loan from MicroInvest to increase her working capital and also to plow the land, but for this she needs fuel and to pay the workers who will help her. Her business was launched in 2000 and now we can say that S. has pretty good results so MicroInvest is sure that this customer will not have any outstanding payments.

loans.use: Buy fuel and pay workers

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade T. is a tailor. She makes lovely designs for her customers. She also sells sarongs.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more sarongs, one sewing machine and a generator. She says that this will help to boost her business.

Ade is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo se inició en la actividad junto a su padre en una empresa de transporte ubicada en la ciudad de Asunción, en el cual trabajó por muchos años.

Trascurrido el tiempo decidió establecer su propio lavadero en la ciudad de Itá. Comenta que al principio le costo mucho sacrificio establecer su propio local y al mismo tiempo formar su clientela ya que solo contaban con poca estructura y pocas máquinarias de utilidad en el lavado de autos.

Gracias al apoyo de su familia logró incorporar nuevas máquinarias al negocio y así también ir fortaleciendo su labor.
texts.en:
Eduardo started his business with his father at a transportation business located in the city of Asunción, where he worked for many years. Over time, he decided to establish his own car wash in the city of Itá. He tells us that, at first, it cost him a great deal of sacrifice to establish his own business and simultaneously grow his customer base. They lacked structure and had little useful machinery for the work of cleaning cars. Thanks to his family’s support, he managed to incorporate new machinery at the business to strengthen it.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To outfit his business with proper equipment.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina R. runs a business where she sells traditional clothes (Vitenge, Khanga and Wax). Her business is in the Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam.

Safina is an entrepreneur. She is a Tanzanian, married woman with three school children.

In order to supply her business, she purchases the items she sells from Mnazi mmoja wholesale shops. She then sells the goods retail to her customers in the Tandika Market. She uses the income she generates to meet her family's daily needs and to pay her children's school fees.

Safina is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to purchase more inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. earns a living selling provisions and drinks to retail customers. She would like to expand her inventory. She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Mary is 45 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. earns a living selling provisions like noodles, milk, sugar, and detergent. She hopes to expand her business. She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions to sell.

She is 37 years old. She is married with 6 children.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix tiene 40 años  y está acompañado con la señora Silvana de 27 años, tienen 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 7 años.

El señor Félix es de profesión panadero, el mismo se inició en dicha actividad desde los 15 años como ayudante en un negocio familiar, luego de varios años recibió de herencia el local, en el cual realizó varias mejoras como ampliación y refacción del mismo.

Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo logró adquirir su propio vehículo y así también construir su casa propia.

El monto solicitado es de Gs.1.200.000 el cual será invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de panificados.
texts.en:
Félix is 40 years old and lives with Silvana who is 27 years old, they have 3 children ages 2, 5, and 7. Félix is by profession a baker. He began working as an assistant in the family business when he was 15 years old, and years later he inherited the business in which he carried out various renovations such as its expansion and refurbishment. Félix comments that his business is going very well; thanks to his efforts he was able to acquire his own vehicle and was also able to build his own house. The amount solicited is 1,200,000 PYG, which will be invested in the purchase of bread-making supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase break-making supplies such as: flour, yeast, salt, etc,

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria E. is 43 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband earns a living selling clothes.

Victoria helps to support her family by selling provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand her business. She therefore needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina J. is a Tanzanian woman. She is a micro entrepreneur. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in primary school.

Adolfina runs a café business in the Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the business for two years. Her family's daily demands rely on the business income she earns.

Now, she needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana E. prepares food for sale at Broyinbima near Elmina. Nana has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband works with the Takwa mines. Nana has been preparing food for sale since 2000. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase food which she will prepare for her costumers. She plans to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food to prepare for sale

loans.name: Omerebele

texts.en:
Omerebele O. runs a small business. She fries beans cakes, popularly known as Akara, to earn a living. She also sells foodstuffs like plantains. She combines these two businesses together to enable her to make more profits.

She needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more foodstuffs like plantains and bags of beans.

She is 45 years old and married with 6 children.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph H. is married and has five dependents. He has received schooling through junior high school. Joseph sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market, which he has done since 1996. His wife is a trader. Joseph uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Joseph will use his loan to increase his stock of used clothing. With the profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to save towards a house he wants to build for his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock of used clothing

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José está casado con la señora Ermelinda de Díaz, tiene 4 hijos, vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de planteras de todos los modelos y tamaños hace más de 18 años. Su fábrica lo tiene situado en su domicilio, dos de sus hijos lo ayudan en el negocio, los demás se dedican a actividades diferentes a la de él, mientras que su señora ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.  Sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Itá, alrededores e interior del país.
 
El señor José solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña y arcilla, los cuales son materias primas esenciales para la elaboración de sus productos, de modo a satisfacer la demanda de un pedido importante que uno de sus clientes solicitó.
texts.en:
José is married to Ermelinda de Díaz; he has four children and lives close to downtown Itá. He has been making and selling planters of all sizes and shapes for more than 18 years. His factory is located in his home; two of his children help him in the business, the other two have their own lines of work. His wife helps with all the household chores. He sells in the city of Itá, in the surrounding areas and in the interior of the country. José is asking for a loan to buy firewood and clay, which are the raw materials essential to his business, in order to fill a large order placed by one of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy E. is a hair stylist. She makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells drinks, both wholesale and retail, to her customers.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more drinks to sell.

She is 34 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en la ciudad de Itá, está casado con la señora María Gómez, tienen un solo hijo en edad escolar.

Comenta que trabajó mucho tiempo como empleado del taller mecánico de un familiar, gracias a  los ahorros que realizaba y al apoyo económicos de sus padres consiguió comprar herramientas varias y montar su propio taller en su domicilio desde hace 6 años, hoy día tiene una clientela conformada por taxistas, repartidores de panificados y particulares a cuyos vehículos realiza mantenimientos, reparación o cambio de repuestos.

Precisa de un préstamo para la construcción de un tinglado en su taller, a modo de que en los días de lluvia o intenso calor pueda brindarles a sus clientes y a si mismo mayor comodidad y atención ya que gracias a los buenos trabajos que realiza van aumentando cada vez más su cantidad de clientes
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of Itá. He is married with María Gómez and they have a school-aged son. He says that we worked for a long time as an employee in a family member's mechanic shop. Thanks to his savings and his parents' financial help he was able to buy various tools and open his own shop in his home six years ago. Today, he has customers who are taxi drivers, bread delivery people and members of the public whose vehicles need maintenance, fixing or spare parts changed. He explains that he needs this loan to build a platform in his shop so that when it rains or is very hot he can give his clients and himself greater comfort and better service as thanks to his good work he is getting new customers daily.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a platform

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con la señora Sandra de 30 años y tienen 2 hijos menores de 3 y 5 años.
El señor Nelson anteriormente trabajaba como empleado en una estación de servicios de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, luego decidió trabajar por cuenta propia, una de las causas por las cuales tuvo la iniciativa de emprender un negocio en forma personal fue que todos los días en horario nocturno apeligraba su vida en sus viajes  constante al trabajo.
Actualmente cuenta con un carro ambulante de venta de bebidas y comidas en gral.  en el cual trabaja en compañía de su esposa, el negocio dió excelentes resultados y el préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de bebidas y embutidos en gral., mediante el cual logró incrementar sus ingresos y así poder brindar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old. He is married to Sandra, aged 30, and they have two young children aged 3 and 5. Nelson worked previously for a service station in the city of San Lorenzo, but later decided to work for himself. One of the reasons for this decision was that every night he was putting his life in danger travelling to work. He is now selling drinks and food from his car. He works with his wife and the business is doing very well. He invested the loan he received in the purchase of drinks and sausages with which he wanted to increase his profits and thus give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, meat and sausages

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 53 años, vive en Itá y está acompañada  con el señor Alfredo. Tienen 2 hijas, Hilda de 31 años quien es licenciada en obstetricia y Diana  de 25 años quien se encuentra cursando el ultimo año de la carrera de medicina.  

      Nora comenta que su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Argentina y que gracias a su ayuda pudo hacerles estudiar a sus hijas, pero como eso no es suficiente empezó a criar pollos  y a comercializarlos   teniendo un ingreso más que ayuda con los gastos de su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, y su alimento, además de vitaminas.
texts.en:
Nora is 53, lives in Itá and is married with Alfredo. They have two daughters: Hilda, 31, a licensed obstetrician and Diana, 25, a student in her last year of medical studies. Nora says that her husband is working in Argentina and that thanks to his help they are able to send their daughters to school, but as it is still not enough money she began raising chickens and selling them for profit to help with the household expenses. She is asking for this loan to buy chickens as well as feed and vitamins.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Speranza's Group

texts.en:
N. Speranza is the chairperson of Mukisa group in Mubende. She is thirty-two years old and has been a teacher in the Tiger Barracks primary school in Mubende for 6 years. Currently she teaches Primary one single-handedly since each teacher is assigned to a class for all subjects. Through hard work, she is thankful that she is managing.

Speranza has managed a canteen at her primary school for 4 years where she sells snacks like chapattis, samosas, biscuits, and stationery like books, pencils, pens, erasers and reams of paper. During the holidays, Speranza switches to farming where she has banana plantations, sweet potatoes and cassava. She is married with 5 children, the youngest being 1 week old and she cares for 3 brothers and 3 sisters. She has benefited by building her own house, has a piggery business and rears local chickens.

She is grateful to the credit officer that when he took them on, they were many in the group, taking very little money with many defaulters. Now they are doing so well with the same number of members, taking more money with more successful businesses. She now needs a loan to help with restocking her canteen with more snacks as well as to employ manpower on her farm since most of the day she is at the school or attending to her baby.

loans.use: Restocking her canteen and labor on the farm.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres  y sus hermanos en el centro de la ciudad de Itá.

Se dedica a la reparación, compra y venta de diversos modelos y marcas de teléfonos celulares hace poco más de un año en un salón que alquila en una zona de comercio estratégicamente ubicada en la ciudad de Itá.

Se inició en esta actividad luego de haber participado de diversos cursos de capacitación de dicha actividad, montó su negocio gracias a la ayuda económica de sus padres quienes son empleados y hoy día ya cuenta con clientela bien formada y a la vez numerosa.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de accesorios varios para celulares para de esa forma aumentar su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Oscar is 21 years old. He is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents and his brothers in the center of the city of Ita. Oscar dedicates himself to repairing, buying and selling various models and brands of cell phones. He has had his business for a little over a year and operates in a rented stall in a commercial zone strategically located in the city of Ita. He started this business after participating in various training courses and established his business with the financial assistance of his parents who are now also employees. He now counts on a well established and large clientele. The loan Oscar is requesting will be used to purchase various cell phone accessories in order to increase his merchandise stock.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 45 años acompañado con la señora Severiana de 41 años, cuentan con 4 hijos.
El señor Oscar es de profesión agricultor el cual le fue heredado de su padre.

Posee 1ha. de tierra fértil en el cual cultiva sus hortalizas como: lechuga, acelga, perejil y tomates. 
Comenta además que sus hijos trabajan con él en su huerta y que gracias a ésto pueden costear sus estudios.

La venta al por mayor de sus productos lo realiza en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá y expresa que cuenta con gran cantidad de pedidos.

El crédito obtenido lo invirtió en la compra de abonos y semillas.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar is 45-years old and lives with his companion Ms. Severiana who is 41-years old. They have four children. Oscar is an agricultural professional which is a skill that has been passed down from his father. He own 1-hectare of fertile land which he cultivates for his vegetables: lettuce, kale, parsley and tomatoes. Also, his children work with him in the orchard and he is thankful he is able to fund their studies.

He sells the best products in the municipal market place in the city of Ita and has a large number of orders. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sabina's Group

texts.en:
N. Sabina, “Jjaja Gonzaga” as she is referred to by her friends and family members, is the leader of the group in Mubende. She has had a business of making pancakes since 1943, when she started with 20 cents and now she is able to cater for her family, especially her grandchildren.

She says that she was introduced to her lending group by well-wishers who saw the burden ahead of her in caring for her family. She received her first loan to reinvest in her business and now she is doing well. She is also a small-scale farmer growing food mostly for home consumption, while before she had enough for sale. Sabina has been able construct rental houses by using her loans and savings and this is also helping her with her home welfare. She needs another loan to help with buying more flour and cooking oil for her pancake business.

loans.use: More flour and cooking oil for her pancake business.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr Kossi K. est né le 07 Juillet 1960 à Hagnigbatodji dans la préfecture de Kloto au Sud du Togo. Marié avec douze (12) personnes à charge, il a comme activité principale la gestion d’un moulin décortiqueuse de riz à Kovié dans la préfecture du Zio. C’est la principale zone rizicole du pays où les rizières sont concentrées le long de la vallée du fleuve Zio. 
Compte de l’intensification de l’activité rizicole dans le milieu, il n’arrive plus avec le seul moulin à décortiquer toute la production des riziculteurs. De plus son moulin tombe de temps en temps en panne engendrant le mécontentement des paysans. Pour y remédier, il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un moulin neuf. Cela lui permettra de faire face aux exigences des riziculteurs et d’accroître considérablement ses recettes et bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi K. was born on July 7, 1960 in Hagnigbatodji in Kloto prefecture in southern Togo. He is married and has twelve people to support. His main work involves running a mill for husking rice, in Kovié in Zio prefecture, which is the principal rice-growing area of the country where rice fields are concentrated along the Zio River valley.

Given the intensification of rice farming in the area and having only one mill, he is no longer able to husk all the rice the growers produce. What’s more, his mill breaks down from time to time, thus engendering discontent among rural people. To remedy the situation, he’s requesting financing to acquire a new mill. This will enable him to address the demands of the rice growers and to increase his receipts and profits considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mill for processing rice

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 42 años, vive en Itá y está acompañado con la señora Carmen. Tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. 
       Comenta que empezó a trabajar con la empresa Luomo hace más de 10 años, y que por problemas económicos su señora fue a trabajar a España dejando a su hijo de apenas  10 meses a su cuidado. Los problemas aumentaron ya que debía  hacerse cargo de su hijo entonces decidió quedarse a trabajar en Itá pero siguiendo con la misma empresa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas y accesorios para poder confeccionar trajes que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pablo is 42 years old, and lives in Itá with his wife Carmen. He has one son who is 2 years old. He comments that he started working in the Luomo Company over 10 years ago. Due to financial problems his wife left to work in Spain leaving their son of barely 10 months in his care. The problems increased given that he had to care for his son, so he decided to stay to work in Itá in the same company. He is requesting a loan to purchase fabrics and accessories to be able to tailor suits, which will help him increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and accessories to tailor suits.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Kladjémé dans la préfecture du Zio, Mme Akou A. est mariée et est mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente des produits cosmétiques et des produits de beauté pour femme. C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plus de cinq (05) ans avec dynamisme et rigueur. Elle est confrontée actuellement à un manque de fonds de roulement pour propulser son activité en ralentissement. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour redynamiser son commerce. Cela lui permettra de satisfaire ses clientes et de rentabiliser son commerce.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Kladjémé in Zio prefecture, Ms. Akou A. is a married mother of two. She specializes in selling cosmetics and women’s beauty products. This is a business she has been working at energetically and rigorously for over five years. She is currently confronted with a lack of operating funds to propel her slowing business. That’s why she’s requesting financing to re-energize her commerce. This will enable her to satisfy her customers and to make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: N. Rose is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is a devoted business lady with a shop selling new clothes of all kinds. She has been in this business long enough to know how to manage her finances well. She is grateful for her loans because they have helped her have enough stock of different kinds, hence winning her more customers. She says she can never forget her primary job of farming since living in a village like Mubende without a farm is rare, due to the fertile soils that favor their crops. Rose needs a loan to help with buying more clothes for sale, mostly from Kampala City.

loans.use: More clothes for sale.

loans.name: Simplice

texts.fr: Mr Simplice A. le 01 Mars 1963 à Tsévié ; il est marié avec cinq (05) personnes à charge. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller loin dans ses études, il est vite entré en apprentissage dans une maison de vente et de réparation de réfrigérateurs usagers. Après la fin de son apprentissage, il ouvrit son propre atelier de réparation et de vente de réfrigérateur. Grâce à son savoir faire, il a gagné la confiance de sa clientèle. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter les matériels de travail et des congélateurs usagers à réparer et à revendre. Cela contribuera énormément à accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Simplice A. was born on March 1st, 1963 in Tsévié. He is married and is responsible for supporting five people. Not having had the opportunity to advance very far in his studies, he quickly began an apprenticeship in a shop specializing in the repair and sale of used refrigerators. At the end of his apprenticeship, he opened his own shop reparing and selling refrigerators. Thanks to his expertise, he has earned the trust of his clientele. He is requesting a loan to purchase work materials and used freezers to repair and resell. This will greatly contribute to the increase of sales and profit for his shop.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The repair and sale of used refrigerators

loans.name: Eufemio Nicolas

texts.es: Eufemio tiene 46 años de edad, reside en laureles sur, en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa, con tres hijos  que estudian,   don Eufemio es albañil desde hace veinte años, inicio como ayudante ahora con la experiencia trabaja por cuenta propio y sus ingresos son mejores, esta es su décima solicitud en la que va invertir en la compra de una computadora para el estudio de sus hijos, lo cual espera sea de muchos beneficios para la superación y aprendizaje de sus hijos, da las gracia a Afodenic ya que con estos prestamos ha salido adelante y espera seguir trabajando y cumplir sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Eufemio is 46 years old. He lives in South Laureles in the city of Managua. He lives with his wife, who is a stay-at-home-mom and his three children who are still in school. Eufemio has been a mason for the last 20 years. Beginning as an assistant, he now has the experience to work for himself and his income is better. This is the tenth time that Eufemio has requested a loan and this time he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a computer for his children to use for their school work. He knows that his children would be able improve their educations and learn more by having access to a computer at home. Eufemio is thankful for Afodenic since he has been able to improve his lifestyle. He hopes to continue working and meeting his goals.

(Translated by Tom of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children to use for schoolwork.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Helena sells plastic products and slippers at Abura, which she has been doing since last year. Her husband is a commercial driver. Helena uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses; her husband takes care of the rest of the family’s financial needs. Helena will use this loan to purchase more plastic products and slippers to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic products and slippers for resale

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Née le 07/12/1964 à Hahotoé et avec trois(03) personnes à charge Mme Afi S. est une femme dynamique et dévouée qui s’est vite adonnée à la vente de pagnes dans sa localité. Elle a réussit à conquérir la confiance de sa clientèle grâce à la qualité de sa marchandise. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et étendre son étalage ,elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 7, 1964 in Hahotoé and responsible for 3 persons, Mrs. Afi S. is a dynamic and devoted woman who began at a young age to sell "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in her locality. She has managed to win the confidence of her clientele thanks to the quality of her merchandise. So as to better respond to the needs of her clientele and expand her assortment, she is requesting a loan. The profit she makes will allow her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of "pagnes"

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: la sra Ernestina reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 44 años de edad, dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, su esposo es contratista, doña Ernestina vende carne de res y inicio con prestamos en financieras.con esta solicitud es para la inversión de compra de carnes para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus ricas carne de res, también va hacer sopas para vender los fines de semana para generar otros ingresos que compra el carnic. La vende ambulante y en su casa. Sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa, poder apoyar a sus hijos a que concluyan sus estudios,  así como hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ernestina lives in the area of South Laureles in the City of Managua. She is 44 years old and she has two children that are 14 and 18. Her husband is a contractor and she sells beef. She was able to start her business because she was able to get loans. She is asking for a new loan so that she will be able to invest in the purchase of fresh meats so that she will be able to offer a greater variety of meats to her customers. She is also going to sell soups on the weekends so she can create more income which she will use to purchase more meat. She is an ambulatory salesperson. Her plan is to be able to finish building her house and to support her two children so that they can finish their studies. She also want to make her business grow.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Kossiwa G. est le 12 /06/1960 .Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari  n’ayant pas un emploi stable,  elle est la seule à subvenir aux charges de la famille grâce à son petit commerce des produits de premières nécessités. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner régulièrement. Ainsi, elle pourra contribuer de mieux en mieux à l’amélioration des conditions de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwa G. was born on June 12, 1960. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her husband has no steady job, so she is the primary breadwinner, thanks to her little general store selling staple goods. Today she is requesting a loan to expand her shelves and restock her store on a regular basis. Thus, she will be better able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Epitasio

texts.es:
Epitasio inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso para mantener a su familia ya que era empleado de una tienda departamental en la que lo liquidaron y le costó trabajo conseguir otro empleo.Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 2007, inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, ya que tenía la inquietud de volver a trabajar, pero su esposa lo alentó para que pusiera su negocio de comida y que juntos lo atenderían.

Gracia s a su esfuerzo y buen servicio les ha ido muy bien, cuentan con un buen numero de clientes entre los cuales se encuentra las maestras de las escuelas de sus hijos, los fines de semana en un mercado ambulante y con la ayuda del taxi que acaba de comprar aprovecha para hacer las entregas de comida y en un futuro desean rentar o comprar un local. 

El necsita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagra en 12 catorcenas  para comprar materia prima para elaborar sus comidas, tal como carne, verduras, aceite, frijol, arroz, desechables, etc. y de esta manera darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Epitasio started the business due to the need to generate income to support his family, since he was an employee at a department store but was let go. He started the business in March of 2007, on his own initiative, because he was anxious to get back to work. His wife encouraged him to start a own food business, and she would help him run it. Thanks to their efforts and the excellent service they provide, things have gone well and they now enjoy a well-established customer base that includes the teachers from their children’s schools. They work weekends at the street market and, with the help of the taxi he just bought, they take advantage of making food deliveries. In the future, they would like to rent or buy a space for their business. He needs a loan of 12,000 MXN, to be repaid in 12 bi-monthly installments, to purchase ingredients such as meats, vegetables, cooking oil, beans, rice, etc. to make their dishes. In this manner, he will be able to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Cirjeu

texts.en: This is Cirjeu A.. She is 48 years old and she lives in Cahul district. Her whole life she lived in Chisinau City but she moved to Cahul district to a local village. When she was young she always dreamed of living in a village where she would have a small house on a hill, next to arable land where she could build a greenhouse together with her husband and to sell vegetables at a wholesele market in the village. Life in Chisinau city was not so appealing because there is of air pollution and heavy traffic. She decided to take a loan from MicroInvest to turn her dreams into reality. With the money borrowed she will increase her working capital. Microinvest wants to thank to Kiva lenders who will help A. to be happy.

loans.use: To start a farming business

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepcion  inició el negocio para poder ayudar a 2 nietas, ya que cuando sus hijos se casaron se fueron de la casa y ella se quedo a cargo de sus nietas.
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 1998 cuando una amiga la invitó a ser parte de un grupo solidario que iba a solicitar crédito en una empresa. En aquel entonces, ella vendía productos cosmeticos y otros productos pero tenía muy poco dinero para invertir, pero cuando entro a este grupo solidario tuvo dinero para invertir en productos de otras lineas.
 
Su negocio ha ido progresando poco a poco ya que ha ido aumentado el número de  clientes y desea llegar a alcanzar el grado MASTER dentro de la empresas multinivel donde vende y también seguir ganando regalos con la venta de sus productos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para  surtir pedidos de sus clientes lo cual le ayudará a entregarlos a tiempo y asi seguir teniéndolos contentos para que sigan comprando sus productos.
texts.en:
Concepcion started her business to be able to support her two granddaughters. When her children got married they moved out of her house and left her in charge of the two girls.

She began her business in February of 1998 when her friend invited her to join a group of entreprenuers that was going to ask for a loan from a company. Back then she sold cosmetic products and other products as well. However, she did not have enough money to invest in her business. When she entered the group and they got the loan, she was able to get enough money to invest in purchasing products from other cometic lines.

Her business has progressed little by little and her number of clients has increased. Her goal is to get to the MASTER level of sales in the multilevel company that she sells products for. She also wants to keep earning gifts from the company by selling products.

She needs a loan for $825. She will make 12 payments every 14 days. She will use the money to by products that her clients order, which will help her to fill her orders on time and will keep her customers happy.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School.)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angelita Maritza

texts.es: Doña Angelita vende lotería desde hace doce años, y es concesionaria ahora y espera crecer en las ventas, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en laureles norte con dos hijos que estudian la secundaria,  su esposo trabaja de albañil, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa para estar cómoda con su familia y gozar de los beneficios y oportunidad que Afodenic ha brindado con los prestamos.  También espera ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms. Angelita has sold lottery tickets for two years and is now an official vendor hoping to grow her sales. She is 45 years old. She lives in Laureles Norte with her two children, who are in high school, and her husband, a bricklayer. With this loan she is going to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house in order to be comfortable with her family and enjoy the benefits and opportunity that AFODENIC has provided her through loans. She also hopes to help her children with their studies so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr  Kokou ATTISO est né le 05 /02/1970 à Agbélouvé (P/Zio).Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants,il est chauffeur de profession. Activité qu’il exerce tant bien que mal dans son village avec son vieux camion servant à la fois de transport de passagers et de marchandises. Actuellement le véhicule est très  fatigué et l’handicape sérieusement dans son travail .Il veut éviter les difficultés énormes auxquelles il s’expose ; c’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui lui permettra d’acheter un nouveau camion de transport pour redonner confiance aux passagers et assurer leur sécurité. Les revenus tirés serviront à veiller au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Attiso was born on February 5, 1970 in Agbélouvé (Zio Prefecture). Married and the father of 5 children, he is a professional driver, a business he works at as best he can in his village, with his old truck which serves to transport both passengers and merchandise. At present, the vehicle is pretty much worn out and is a serious handicap in his work. He wants to avoid the enormous difficulties he is facing, and that is why he requested a loan to buy a new truck to restore confidence among his passengers and keep them safe. The income from this will help him to see to the welfare of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a new truck

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia inició el negocio por el deseo de progresar y ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar y además le gusta mucho el comercio ya que en sus trabajos anteriores siempre estuvo relacionada con las ventas y fue lo que la animó a poner su propio negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Enero de 2007

Inicio el negocio con el dinero que le dieron cuando la liquidaron en su trabajo  invirtio una parte para comprar ropa y con la ayuda de su familia pudo venderla en poco tiempo y  obtener ganancias.
 
Su negocio ha ido progresando ya que cada vez puede comprar más mercancía y de mejor calidad la cual a veces ya le resulta insuficiente para el número de clientes que tiene además de que acaba de implementar también la venta de edredones, cobertores y toallas.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar maercancia y asi  contar con un buen surtido de ropa para estas fechas del día de San Valentín y para la temporada de primavera que está próxima a comenzar.
texts.en:
Natalia began her business from a desire to progress and help pay for the household expenses and also because she really enjoys working in sales. Her previous jobs were always related to sales and they inspired her to start her own business. She began her business in January of 2007. She started the business with the money they gave her when she was laid off from her job. She invested part of the money in clothing and with the help of her family she was able to sell it in a short amount of time and earn money. Her business has been progressing and each time she is able to buy more merchandise and higher quality merchandise and she sometimes does not have enough for the number of customers she has. She has also begun to sell quilts, blankets, and towels. She needs a loan of $5300 MXN ($375 USD) that will be repaid in 10 installments (4 months) to buy merchandise and be able to count on having a good clothing selection for Valentine's Day and for the spring season that will soon begin.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana Evelia

texts.es:
Juany inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que tuvo oportunidad de trabajar en alguna empresa porque estudio una carrera universitaria pero no quizo descuidar la educación de sus hijos, fue por eso que decidío emprender una actividad que le permitiera tener más libertad de horario. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 2006, gracias a su abuelita que le enseño a elaborar una gran variedad de comidas y como no tenía utensilios para iniciar el negocio tuvo que pedirlos prestados a sus  vecinas la cuales la apoyaron de esta manera y  le ha ido muy bien.

Poco a poco fue comprando  utensilios de cocina como ollas, vaporeras, cucharas, vasijas, etc., y de esta manera ya no tiene que pedirlos prestados y puedo ahorrarse tiempo en la elaboración de sus comidas.
Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 que pagara en 10 catorcenas.
Con este crédito va a poder comprar materia prima para elaborar sus comidas y reemplazar algunos utensilios de cocina que debido al uso ya se encuentran en malas condiciones, todo esto le permitirá darle un mejor servicio a mis clientes.
texts.en:
Juany began a business to help her husband with the household expenses. She had the opportunity to work in a company because she did complete university studies but she didn’t want to ignore her children’s education so she decided to start a business that would enable her to have a more flexible schedule. She began the business in March 2006, thanks to her grandmother who showed her how to make a large variety of dishes and as she didn’t have any utensils to start her business she had to borrow some from her neighbors who supported her by lending her equipment. Her business has gone well for her. Little by little she has been buying kitchen utensils such as pots, steamers, spoons, etc. and in this way she didn’t have to borrow any and she could save time in making her food. She needs a loan for $5300 MXN which will be repaid in 10 bimonthly payments. With this loan she is going to be able to buy raw ingredients to make her dishes and replace some kitchen utensils that, due to use, are in poor condition. All this will enable her to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Agée d’une cinquantaine d’années, Mme Amélé N. est mariée avec quatr(04) personnes à charge. C’est une femme dynamique qui exerce comme activité la préparation et la vente de riz au bord des rues dans sa localité. La qualité et l’hygiène de ses repas lui ont conférées une bonne renommée et lui  attire beaucoup de clients. Pour permettre à ses clients de manger dans de bonnes conditions et dans un bon cadre, elle sollicite un financement pour aménager un local décent et propice pouvant accueillir ses clients, s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en sac de riz  et autres denrées. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Amélé N. is fifty-something, married, and has four children to support. This is an energetic woman whose work involves making and selling rice on roadsides in her town. The quality and hygienics of her meals have earned her some fame and has attracted many customers. To have her customers eat under the right conditions and in a nice environment, she’s requesting financing to fix up a decent and conducive spot for accommodating her customers and for acquiring enough supplies of rice and other goods. She can thus increase her revenues, which allow her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a nice spot and to get supplies of rice

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma  inició el negocio porqué su esposo es pescador y en las temporadas de veda, que son muy largas, se quedaba sin trabajar y el dinero que guardaba no les alcanzaba para sobrevivir todo ese tiempo, por lo que decidío apoyarlo iniciando su negocio de promotora de calzado.  Comenzó el negocio en Junio de 2003 gracias a que una compañera con la cual solicito un crédito, vio la necesidad que ella tenía de obtener un ingreso para apoyar a su esposo y le comentó que ella era promotora de calzado, fue entonces que la acompañó a pedir informes y le pareció un buen negocio por lo que se decidío a trabajar en esto.    

En los casi seis años que tiene dedicandose a esta actividad ha aumentado considerablemente su cartera de clientes por lo que en la actualidad ya maneja un número importante lo cual le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para adquirir más mercancía que le permitirá atender mejor los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma has a business selling shoes. She began her business because her husband is a fisherman and they were never able to save enough money to cover their expenses during the long off-season when he was unemployed. A friend recognized her need for additional income and encouraged her to seek a loan to start her business.

Irma began her business in June 2003, and in the almost seven years since she has greatly increased her client base, which has enabled her to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Mexican pesos (US $700), to be repaid in 10 installments, to purchase more merchandise to better meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mme Abra A. est née en 1980 à Bolou dans la préfecture du Zio. C’est une femme mariée avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études et s’est lancée très tôt dans de petits commerces notamment la vente de produits de premières nécessités. Malgré l’expérience qu’elle a acquise dans ce domaine, elle manque cruellement de fonds pour développer son activité. Elle sollicite donc un crédit pour doper son commerce en s’approvisionnant suffisamment en marchandises. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ms. Abra A. was born in 1980 in Bolou in Zio prefecture. She is a married woman with three children in her care. Not having had the chance to pursue schooling, she got started early on with small-scale commerce, notably the sale of essential goods. Despite the experience she has acquired in this field, she is terribly short of funds for developing her business. She’s therefore requesting a loan to boost her commerce by supplying herself with sufficient merchandise. This will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell essential goods

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara  inició el negocio por deseos de superación y de salir adelante con la ayuda de su pareja para poder brindarle mejor atención médica a su hija Blanca Estela que es discapacitada, y así pueda ir mejorando cada día. Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 2005 ayudándole a una tía y ella le daba una comisión pero luego ella le insistió que ella iniciara un negocio propio para que toda la ganancia fuera para ella, y aunque tardo un poco en animarse, finalmente aceptò, de lo cual no se arrepiento porque realmente le deja muy buena ganancia y con eso puedo ayudar a su pareja con los gastos de la casa.   

Poco a poco va teniendo más clientes que compran su producto lo cual ha hecho que también aumenten sus ganancias.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas. 
Con este crédito va a comprar más productos para vender en este día de San Valentín que se acerca y en el cual la gente aprovecha para regalar.
texts.en:
Clara began her business because she and her husband want to get ahead. Her daughter Blanca Estela is disabled, and Clara is working to provide better medical care so that her condition will improve.

She began her business in February 2005 by helping her aunt, who provided a commission. Later, her aunt encouraged her to start her own business so that all of her earnings would be hers. It took a while for Clara to warm to the idea, but she finally did, and she has never regretted the decision, since she now has a good income and is able to help her husband with the household expenses. She has been able to slowly but surely build her customer base, which has increased her earnings.

Clara is requesting a loan for 10,000 Mexican pesos (US $700), to be repaid in ten installments. With the money, she will buy merchandise for her customers to give as Valentine's Day gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through primary (elementary) school. Theresa sells used clothing at the Pedu near Abura, which she has done for the last nine years. Her husband is a plumber. Theresa uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses while her husband takes care of the family’s remaining financial needs. Theresa will use her loan to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Theresa plans to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing machines and to fix up a workshop

loans.name: Aridjatou

texts.fr: Mme Aridjatou T. est née à Tchamba en 1948 ; elle est mariée avec quatre (04) personnes à charge. Son commerce de produits céréaliers lui réussit très bien. C’est une activité dans laquelle elle tire d’énormes bénéfices lui permettant de scolariser ses enfants et aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Pour constituer un stock important de céréales en cette période d’abondance où les prix chutent, elle sollicite un crédit. Les profits tirés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aridjatou T. was born in Tchamba in 1948. She is married and take care of 4 persons. Her cereal selling business has served her very well. It is a business which provides her with great benefits and has provided schooling for her children and assisted her husband with meeting the family needs. She has requested a loan to maintain sufficient inventory during this period of abundance when prices are falling. The profits generated will allow her improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Margarita Concepcion

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y ademas le gustan mucho las ventas y como sus hijos ya están grandes y pueden valerse solos  le quedaba más tiempo libre. 
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 2006  en el patio de su casa vendiendo la ropa que dejában de usar, después una de sus vecinas la animó para que comprara pacas de ropa usada las cuales salen muy baratas y se venden rápido y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.  

Poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y en la actualidad ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes que compran la ropa usada que trai de Estados Unidos.
Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $7000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas .
Con este crédito va a poder comprar pacas de ropa usada para la temporada de primavera y verano que esta próxima y así tener un buen surtido para su clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita started the business because she wanted to feel useful and because she likes sales. Her children are grown now and can take care of themselves so she has plenty of free time. She started the business in February 2006, on the patio of her house, selling used clothes. Later, a neighbor gave her the idea to buy bundles of used clothes which were selling very cheaply and quickly turn them around. Things have been going well ever since. Margarita's sales have increased bit by bit and she can now count on a good number of customers who buy used clothes brought from the United States. She needs a MXN$7,000 loan that she will pay in 10 14-day installments. She will use the money to buy bundles of used clothes appropriate for the coming spring and summer seasons so that she has a good supply for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Nohelia

texts.es: La joven Sandra tiene 28 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, con dos hijos que estudian la primaria, su esposo trabaja de conductor, ella redesempeña de operaria en zona franca, pues es cansado ya que tiene que trabajar rápido para poder ganar mejor, este es su tercer ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro frontal en su casa. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, cambiar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young woman of 28 years of age who resides in Laureles Norte with two children who study in primary school. Her husband works as a driver. She works in a tax-free area, and it is a tiring job since she has to work fast to be able to earn more. This is her third loan cycle with Afodenic. She will invest in buying construction materials to build a frontal wall on her home. Her plans are to be able to finish building her house and change jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr: Née en 1959, Mme Safiatou A. est mariée avec quatre (04) personnes à charge. Elle est commerçante de produits céréaliers. Cette activité qu’elle exerce depuis plusieurs années marche très bien et elle compte la développer. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour pouvoir stocker davantage de céréales, le mais notamment, pendant cette saison d’abondance et les revendre en période de soudure. Cela dopera forcement son commerce, augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices et améliorera ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1959, Mrs. Safiatou A. is married and has four people in her care. She is a retailer of cereal products. This business, which she has been running for several years, runs very well, and she intends to develop it further. This is why she is asking for a loan to stock more cereals, especially maize, during the ongoing season of abundance, and to re-sell them during leaner times. This will boost her business, increase her sales figures and profits, and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane A. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through junior high. Jane sells underwear and baby clothing at Abura, which she has done for about three years. Jane uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Jane will use her loan to purchase additional stock of underwear and baby clothes to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. Jane plans to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of underwear and baby clothes

loans.name: Lélatou

texts.fr: Agée d’une quarantaine d’année, Mme Lélatou O. est mariée avec deux (02) personnes à charge. Elle mène comme activité la vente de produits céréaliers (mais, mil, sorgho etc.…). Très dynamique et dévouée dans activité qu’elle exerce depuis presque dix (10) ans, elle compte la développer avec pour objectif de vendre en gros. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour pouvoir stocker davantage de céréales, pendant cette saison d’abondance et les revendre en période de soudure. Cela augmentera forcement son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices et améliorera ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lélatou O. is in her forties and married with two people in her care. She runs a business selling cereal products (maize, millets, sorghum, etc.). Very dynamic and dedicated to the business that she has been running for almost ten (10) years, she intends to develop it with the goal of selling in bulk. This is why she is asking for a loan to stock more cereals during the ongoing season of abundance and to re-sell them during leaner times. This will undoubtedly increase her sales figures and profits and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell cereals

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr: Née le 10/01/1970 au Ghana, Mme Madina O. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfant. C'est une commerçante de condiments pour la sauce et de charbon de bois. Ce petit commerce lui permet de pouvoir prendre en ses enfants. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux contribuer aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on the 10th of January 1970 in Ghana, Mrs. Madina O. is married and has five (05) children. She is a retailer of condiments for sauce and of firewood. This small business allows her to take care of her children. She is asking for a loan to expand her display of goods. In this way, she will be able to better contribute to meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household products

loans.name: Cpk Ii Group

texts.en:
Matane sells scrap metal. She was taught by her mother from 1978 to 1979 the business of selling spices and smoked fish. From 1990 to 1994, she started her own business with a beginning capital of $100, selling cartons of tomatoes, onions and spices. In 1994, her aunt taught her how to sell scrap metal. She started this business with $100 as beginning capital. In 1995, she bought a stall at the market called Lufungula. With hard work and good management, Matane prospered in her business until 2006. She increased her working capital to $700.

From 2006 to 2007, her business decreased to $50 because of family difficulties due to rising rent costs and her husband’s long absence in Angola, without any news of his welfare. After this, she joined one of Hope’s groups in February 2007, and she reinforced her business by increasing the inventory. Currently, her working capital is $400 and she makes $100 per month as profit. Her ambition is to open a scrap metal store. Matane is married and the mother of five children between the ages of 7 and 20, who are all in school.

loans.use: To reinforce working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Balkissou

texts.fr:
Mme Balkissou B. est née en 1948 au Ghana,et a en charge cinq(O5) personnes. Son mari, chauffeur en retraite n’arrive pas contribuer suffisamment aux charges du ménage. Avec son petit commerce de Gombo, un légume très apprécié, Mme B. est seule face aux multiples charges de famille. N’ayant pas de moyens financiers, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner régulièrement en grande quantité en gombo.
Les revenus tirées de ce commerce lui permettront de bien s’occuper de sa famille et d’améliorer ainsi leur conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Balkissou B. was born in 1948 in Ghana, and has five (5) people in her care. Her husband, a retired chauffeur, is unable to contribute enough to the household expenses. With her small business selling okra, a highly valued vegetable, Mrs. B. bears the responsibility of meeting the many family expenses. Not having enough financial means, she is asking for a loan to supply herself regularly with large quantities of okra. The income drawn from this business will allow her to take care of her family and thus improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell okra (vegetables)

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Linda sells footwear and underwear at Abura, which she has done for the last ten years. Her husband is a trader. Linda uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and other financial needs of the family. Linda will use the loan to purchase additional stock of underwear and footwear to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Linda plans to reinvest her additional profits back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of footwear and underwear

loans.name: Bordinia

texts.es:
La sra Bordinia vende ropa y zapatos desde hace ocho años en los departamento del norte, en la época de invierno se le complica sus ventas debido al mal estado de las carreteras y las lluvias, inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de su esposo,  doña Bordinia tiene 50 años 
De edad,  reside en laureles norte, tiene tres hijos mayores, su esposo es jubilado y recibe su pensión, con la solicitud de crédito va invertir en reparación del techo que esta en mal estado y hacer una pared. Sus planes es poder viajar y comprar mercadería al exterior para comprar y vender más favorables a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bordinia has sold clothing and shoes for the past 8 years in the northern departments of Nicaragua. In the winter season her sales become complicated due to poor road conditions and the rain. She started her business with her own funds and help from her husband. Bordinia is 50 years old, lives in north Laureles, and has 3 older children; her husband is retired and receives a pension. With this loan request she will invest in the repair of her roof that is currently in poor conditions and in building a wall. Her plan is to be able to travel and purchase merchandise abroad, and to offer her clients more favorable sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase construction materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Floriberta

texts.es:
Floriberta  inició el negocio ya que ella  tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos y cubrir las necesidades que tenían. Comenzó el negocio en Junio de 2004 como ella trabajo mucho tiempo en una pollería pero ganaba poco y no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de la casa, fue entonces que el que era su jefe le propuso que ella pusiera mi propio local y con su ayuda pudo instalar su negocio. 


Poco a poco ha ido haciendo  mas clientes, ya compre un refrigerador grande para los pollos, sillas y mesas para que la gente pueda comer en el establecimiento y ademas pinto y rotulo el local con algo de publicidad.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3300 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para  comprar pollos al mayoreo, verduras y chile, platos y vasos desechables, bolsas de polietileno, y algunas sillas y mesas de plástico.
texts.en:
Floriberta started the business because she had to support her children and provide for their everyday needs. She started it in June 2004 when she was working for a poultry processor and needed to earn more money in order to cover family expenses. Her boss suggested that she set up her own shop and, with his (or her) help, she was able to start the business.

She's been slowly picking up customers ever since. She recently bought a large refrigerator for the poultry, chairs and tables so that people could eat in the shop and paint and signs for advertising.

She needs a MXN$3,300 loan, to be repaid in 8 14-day installments, to buy wholesale supplies of chickens, vegetables and chiles, along with plates, glasses, disposable tableware, plastic bags and more chairs and tables.
